This guy is hilarious and he hands out extra credit like candy. This class was definitely a highlight of my semester. It's not hard, but you also definitely need to review a little before the test. Graded on two exams and a final paper. Be sure to go to class so you can enjoy his funny stories and get in on those extra credit points.

Osei is really great and passionate about Advertising and the communication field. He is super enjoyable to listen to but honestly I scrolled through pinterest during lecture and pulled out a 94. Study his study guide topics and you'll do great on the exam

Appiah is the best professor I've had at Ohio State.  He is so funny and down to earth, and makes his lectures relatable and interesting.  Although he doesn't hardly ever take attendance, I always wanted to go.

This class is easy. He wants you to pass, plain and simple. He makes a study guide before each exam, and tells you basically what's going to be on it. He worked at Nike in the marketing department, so he knows what he is talking about. Plus he plays basketball and volleyball with students for extra credit.
Great professor! Easy class. He obviously enjoys his job and meeting new people. I definitely recommend him.
Great class, great prof!

This was an OK class. He's very funny, but gets off topic. Attendance isn't mandatory but he doesn't post anything online and in class he tells you exactly what questions will be on tests. I guess you could read the textbook and still pass the tests, but if you went to class you'll do better. Also he gives lots of extra credit.

Professor Osei is pretty funny and you can learn things on his lecture. He relies on his two TAs and they almost took charge on everything like midterms and finals for whole class. Every American student loves Osei but for an international student it's hard for me to understand all his lectures. Also, his tests are tough for me and my grade is suck

Dr. Appiah is very funny and his class is enjoyable. No attendance taken but he doesn't post notes online. He also offers A LOT of extra credit usually when people don't show up. His midterms can be a little bit confusing but you can get an A if you show up and do the work. He doesn't always reply to emails though which I thought was very annoying.
BEST teacher at OSU hands down! who doesn't love Osei? But very relatable and his work is easy and not too complicated

One of my favorite teachers at Osu! He is so funny and down to earth. He gives real world examples that help you remember class info. You get to watch movies about Mcdonalds and Nike. He worked at Nike too which is pretty neat! Easy exams multiple choice and short answer. I studied and got A's and High B's and i typically don't test well. EC avail.

He talks about himself a good amount. He is funny which helped. He knew a lot of info...But if he doesn't have a TA. Then he is super unorganized. The class material was clear but he was terrible at responding to my emails personally. Gives a lot of extra credit which was nice.
Osei is a boss!! Great class very interesting. Exams were tough! Doesnt post his notes online go to class everyday!

I had Osei for COMM 4445 and COMM 2331 and he was one of the coolest professors I've ever had.  His exams are pretty easy and if you pay attention and go to class, there is no way you wont pass either class.

Osei is the best teacher ever! He is so hilarious, we sometimes get so off track with all his stories. The material is easy, and he puts everything on power points; but you can only get the notes if you go to class. Exams are pretty easy if you study. Overall, he is the best professor I've had.
Osei was the man. His lectures were a pretty entertaining mix of stories and actual material. If you show up to class, the book is unnecessary. Easy A.

I believe it was the first day of class that he rambled on for a few minutes about his life and what it was like for him to grow up in California and how he doesn't like Ohio because it is cold and how he has never wanted to work/have a job. It was entertaining...and it was accurate...he does not want to work...

Very easy going guy, and so is his class.  He favors black people, but whatever.  He hates the winter weather in Ohio so every two weeks he flies back home to California so the TA just pops in a pointless video to entertain the class on days he is absent.  Pretty easy.  Taking notes on a laptop can be beneficial!  Must be nice to be Ossei. "ah-say"

Do you want to hear about how he played bball with Snoop Dogg, "could've" played in the NBA, worked for Nike, Apple, and a top ad agency in the world and hear at least 1 super innapropriate comment every class? Then this class is for you. It takes him over 3 weeks to grade scantron exams, and he never answers emails. 2nd class w/him & hes annoying.
This guy is pretty good. Sometimes the test are hard and there is nowhere to keep track of the grades but overal he makes class interesting enough to attend.Only class I am yet to skip.

Osei can run circles around students half his age. He used to be a great basketball player back in CA; he is blessed with excellent athletic abilities. A great teacher and a scholar. handsome enough to be a hollywood actor; can wow the ladies and make them faint like nine pins in a bowling alley. Too bad he got married at ISU--a dream professor.
Osei is great makes class anjoyable, he is funny and relates class to real world experience not what the text says.  Great class gets everyone involved and makes for a great learning environment

A certain boy wonder like me entered Appiah's class from a foreign country way back at ISU.This guy is awesome, I thought, why don't we have more teachers like him back home? I felt blessed to be his student. A stanford and cornell educated basketball master. Bravo, bravo, bravo.It was a pleasure to learn from you.
Very interesting class. Lots of chances for extra credit. Dr Appiah knows his stuff and is very intelligent.

Osei definitely made this class for me; he also has a lot of useful info because of his time in the industry. Extra credit is offered in class so attendance isn't mandatory but it's definitely worth it. Also some questions on tests come from lecture notes that can't be found in the text. If you need a GEC or it is required don't fear.

He gives you time to get all the note on the slide before he move on. His tests are really straight forward and not hard, but usually about 15% of the test is based on stories he talks about in class that you wont find in the book. Easy A, you don't have to attend all the time, and the TA is this really hot blonde chick.
Osei made the class interesting and worth my while to go. Definitely one of the best profs I've had at OSU and would definitely recommend taking him if needed.

Osei is one of the best professors I have had at OSU.  He is an EXPERT in his field of work having experience at Nike and I am pretty sure he worked at Apple.  He keeps lecture entertaining and knows so much about Strategic Comm. Principles.  The man went to Cornell and Stanford! He is a genius.

Sub-par. There are much better teachers. He knows so much about the subject, but doesn't know how to teach it. He inserts useless stories and talks on his opinions and his research while his TA's do the majority of the work in the class.
Great teacher, really funny.  It's a good class, but there is a lot of reading.  Class attendance isn't required, but you'll actually want to go.

I thought that "Strategic Communication Prinicples" was going to be really boring, but he made it really interesting. He obviously has lots of experience in this area and he was really good about keeping class interesting. His TA that wrote the test wasn't very helpful, but that wasn't Osei's falut. Take his class, its awesome.

Fun teacher gives extra credit for answering questions during class! tells lots of jokes and brings his real world experiences into the classroom and relates them  only problem is some things on study guide/exam are not in book or lecture and you have to go find it online

He is a great Professor. He teaches the class in a way where it is fun and interesting. His exams are a bit difficult for the material he teaches, but as long as you come to class your grade should be no lower than a B.
He doesn't post grades which I found annoying because his TA was really bad. Fun teacher, but exams hard.

Very nice guy and fun classes. Only problem i have is that he makes his tests too hard for the material covered. Makes each question have almost 2 identical answers for multiple choice. Does a horrible horrible job of answering emails too. But overall a good instructor.

He's cool. Very interesting material and a great teaching style. Every class was fun. He's a little elusive though and difficult to meet with. Luckily the tests are easy and don't require a lot of elaboration outside of the regular class time.

Osei was a fantastic comm professor!  He literally brought the subject to life through extensive use of example commercials. Made a 1hr48min class SO fun and interesting. Offered lots of extra credit, and tests were of medium difficulty; nothing you cant do if you study the inclass notes. Oh, and he is absolutely hilarious. You will love this guy.
Class was not difficult overall, however it is tough to get ahold of him outside of the classroom. Go to class and you should get no lower than a B.

Maybe the best professor I have ever had. It was actually fun to go and sit in lecture for an 1hr30. He knew his stuff, he was funny, class was interactive. The tests were based alot off of the text so you need to read in this class, but there couldn't be a better prof for this class. A+++

Wonderful teacher! Definetly knows his stuff! I went to class ever time we had it, and was always glad that I did. He was very helpfu and always willing to further explain things if you needed it. I HIGHLY recomment this teacher, it was a great experience!

Very intelligent professor who is definitely an expert in advertising.  He has a way of making even the most boring topic interesting.  It is amazing that a class can be so fun while being so informative.  I would take any class that he offered, I don't care if it's Advertising 22431.
Amazing! Osei is hilarious and so interesting. He makes the material fun by applying it to real life. What other teacher lets you watch Superbowl commercials in class?!  great, fun, easy class!

This guy was freakin' awesome!  Very intelligent, clear, concise, helpful, funny, fun, and and all around good prof.  Class wasn't that bad either, very interesting stuff, and he definitely knows what he's talking about.  Take any and all classes that you can with him, you won't be sorry!
Good stuff
He's a wonderful teacher.  I highly recommend taking him.
Easy- take it.  Book not necessary, just study the notes from class.  Funny guy who has an impressive resume.

This man is interesting and knows his stuff.  He has lots of experience and teaches on a level that students can learn from and WANT to learn from.  He is straight forward with his tests and if you read the book and study you will have no problem  I would highly recommend this class!

I don't know how anyone could give this prof a poor rating. He's the best I've ever had! His past experience in the industry makes him extremely knowledgeable. His stories and way of teaching make him entertaining! I want to take every class he teaches!
Advertising & Society - great class, never a dull moment!

professor uses cuss words and slurs during his lectures. There is only four tests which makes it inconvenient for success. He is also very insensitive and does not care if you have personal things going on. He also will use pointless info for test questions like “who won the national championship” when I had 4 pages of notes with actual importance

Easily the best professor I've ever had. Practically every class is a lecture, but he makes all of the lectures extremely entertaining and funny, so I was always looking forward to going, despite usually having horrible attendance in my classes. There's only a few grades, but the tests are extremely easy if you went to class. 100% take his class.

Crisis Comm with Professor Holt is AMAZING! Lectures are engaging, interesting, and applicable to real life. You have to be mentally tough to take this class. Take good notes and be ready for the press conference as if your life depends on it. Loved Professor Holt so much and wish I could take his class again!

Holt is an average professor teaching an interesting subject, but he's not remarkable. I could do without all the "Coach Carter" theatrics he brings to the class. He likes to act like crisis communication is the Bible for the rest of your life, but honestly, most of what he teaches is just basic ethics and outdated crisis management strategies.

If you are weak-minded or easily offended DON'T take this class. This class is for students who want to exceed the average mindset. This professor will become either your best friend or your enemy there's no in-between. He will push you to become a better person and also a better professional. If you don't attend the class I PROMISE you'll FAIL.

The best professor I have had in my 7-year college career! He cares about you, but you have to care too. His tests are straight-forward and come directly from lectures. He teaches very different from other professors and prepares students for the real world.

Lanier Holt is one of a kind. He is undoubtedly one of the best professors I have ever had. He makes class so intellectually stimulating and always leaves you with a feeling. His teaching will never bore you.  He takes theories and puts them in real-world scenarios instead of reading boring 60-page papers. Highly recommend taking Crime and News.

Dr. Holt has been one of my favorite professors I've had in college so far. His lectures are some of the most engaging and interactive lectures I've ever seen. He is pretty intimidating but a nice guy who cares about your success if you do the work. The press conference is pretty intimidating and intense so be prepared.

Dr. Holt is the best professor I have ever had. His lectures are so engaging and sound like podcast episodes, and his exams are very straightforward with open notes. The entire grade is based off of 4 non cumulative exams, and the content for this course is presented in a very tasteful manner. Highly recommend.

One of the best professors I've had at OSU. Holt really cares about teaching and keeps lectures interesting with his great sense of humor and seriousness when need be. You do have to watch the lectures, do the readings, and take notes to get a good grade, but the content is always manageable and interesting. Wish I could have him again!

Best professor I've ever had at any university. This professor genuinely wants his students to LEARN rather than just memorize concepts and play a system. I took Crisis Communication (COMM 3333) and it's incredibly helpful and applicable to real life. Holt lectures are always very interesting. He teaches in an entertaining manner but very effective

Dr. Holt's class was my favorite class I've ever taken and it's not close. He starts the semester very intimidating and is not afraid to call you out in front of the class, but you will learn a ton. His lectures are engaging and interesting, myself and several students used to talk about how it felt like we should clap after every class. Must take!

BEST prof. EVER. Dr. Holt prepares you for the real world. Youll learn more from this class than any other. The course consists of 3 exams & a press conference. He prepares you well for both. Tests are noncumulative. Study your class notes. Youll be fine. The press conference topics are intimidating, but do the work & have fun with it.

First day of class scared me, but as the semester goes on, you get to know Dr. Holt and how he teaches. The most intimidating thing about the class is the press conferences, but if you know your stuff, you'll do fine. I can say without a doubt that Dr. Holt is one of the best professors I encountered at Ohio State.

Professor Holt is brilliant and humorous. His classes are interesting and well- organized. If you take classes carefully, it is easier to handle the exams. There are only 3 exams and one press conference. Press conference is an important and useful assignment and u need to prepare it carefully. Very nice class!!!!��

Professor Holt is one of the best professors to exist. He genuinely cares about his students and their success in the real world after college. He is as real as it gets, but also manages to make you laugh. 100% recommend taking a class with him.

I know someone already said it, but Holt was the reason I created this account. First day of class I was scared to hell and back, but as the year went on, I grew to love him, and I can say without a doubt he is the BEST professor at Ohio State. Even if you aren't a COMM major, I recommend you take this class.

Holt is the BEST. I wish I had him before my senior year so I could take another class with him. His lectures are super interesting and he loves cracking jokes. I actually was excited to show up to class. The press conference is a real b*tch, but was an awesome experience. 12/10 would recommend this prof and this class.

Intimidating. One of the realist profs at OSU in the comm field. Graded by three exams and your press conference which is as intimidating as it sounds. You learn to think on your feet. Learned more in his class than any others here at OSU. If you are not up for some intimidation and laughs, do not take this class.

Professor Holt is by far the absolute best professor ever to exist at OSU. If you are lucky enough to be offered his class, do not hesitate for a second. He cares for his students and is so genuine. Wish I could take more of his classes.

Dr. Holt is one of the best professors at OSU by far. His lectures are so engaging. He really cares about his students. The press conference is a bit daunting, but it gives you real world experience. It was by far my favorite part of the class! I have learned more in this one class than my two previous semesters at OSU. Seriously so grateful.

My favorite prof. of all time ever. Amazing human. Cares. As for the class, just show up. Lectures are actually interesting and engaging. 1 midterm, 1 final, and 1 group project- that's it. Press conference is brutal but as long as you put work in you'll do fine. The best class I've taken IN MY LIFE. Get to know Holty, he's a freaking awesome guy.

Holt is the reason I made this account. Easily the best instructor I've ever had, as well as the best class I've ever taken. Always looked forward to going, & the information was always critical, relevant, and engaging. Not required to graduate, but easily the most valuable class you could take. Couldn't recommend more.
Worst prof I have ever had. Mean-spirited and generally horrible. Knows nothing about what he teaches.

He is blunt and speaks his mind, but he sets that expectation. While class isnt mandatory, you will want to go in order to pass. The readings are covered in class so you dont really need to read them. He is the best professor I have ever had, I am disappointed I only got to take one class with him. 100% cares about his students. 10/10.

Holt is hands down the BEST professor i have ever had at OSU. He genuinely cares about his students and wants them to succeed even after the class is over. I learned a lot of info that i can use in my future career. But YOU MUST go to class, If you skip it you wont pass.
THE best/most interesting professor at OSU by far. The only class I have ever had where I paid attention every second. Highly recommend!

One of the best professors and courses. I learned so much that is applicable to the real world. He doesn't try to trick you on the exams and the paper are very straight forward. You NEED to go to class and take detailed notes on the lectures (not posted before/after). He pulls every question from the colored text. He is accessible outside class.
Best professor I've ever had by a long shot! If you are reading this... TAKE THIS CLASS!

Dr. Holt has been my favorite professor at Ohio State by far. He gives amazing lectures, doesn't give trick questions on the exam, you will do fine if you go to class especially review for the exam! He wants to see you succeed and is very knowledgable in his field. If you go to class and pay attention you will be fine.

Took the class for my Leadership Studies minor and it was one of my favorite classes at Ohio State. He truly cares about the subject and the students. He will call you out & make you really think but as long as you come to class you will get an A. Intercultural Communications should be a required course for every student because it matters.

Dr. Holt is easily the best professor I've had during my time at Ohio State. He is an incredible lecturer and each class has a different meaning with new depth on the subject matter. Not only is he hilarious, but he makes me want to learn more. Would 10/10 recommend Intercultural Comm & Dr. Holt!

Professor Holt is one of the best professors in the School of Communication. Lectures are always engaging, and you'll be surprised by how much you learn just from showing up and participating in class. You will also come away from his classes with real-world skills and a new perspective on public relations/the communication industry.
Best professor at OSU by far. Highly recommend taking COMM3333
He is incredible at making his students want to be better. He prepares you for the real world better than any teacher I've had.
Dude might know a lot about the subject but he's not the best at getting it across. Would prefer to learn without being chastized.

I made this account to recommend Dr. Holt. God forbid you ever try & address him as Dr; insisting upon Lanier, or just "Holt". I cant think of a teacher as remarkable as Holt. Beside the decorated accomplishments -Honeywell, Chicago Tribune, Ph.D- he TRULY cares. Facilitating your growth as a pier moreso than a student. Nice, funny, engaging. GOAT.
My least favorite prof I've had at OSU. Learned nothing significant about the subject and extremely rude to students during lectures.

Dr. Holt is probably the best professor I've had at Ohio State. He puts a lot of effort into his lectures and makes them interesting. Class isn't mandatory, but students want to come to his lectures so they're usually full. He gives his honest opinion and grades fairly. I definitely am taking another class by him in the future!

Holt is hilarious! Very blunt with everything and will tell you when it is his opinion. Great teacher who really seems to care about the students. Posts slides but they don't make sense if you didn't go to class. Few grades, primarily tests. Really good at responding to questions and brings a LOT of recent events into everything. One of the best.
He is more than willing to work with you if you need the help. He says what's on his mind, but never in a disrespectful way. Very honest!
Holt is probably the best professor I've ever had.  He doesn't require you to go to class, but people show up just to listen to his lectures. TAKE HIS CLASS NO MATTER WHAT

He made class fun to go to, and he truly wants his students to succeed and learn. One of the best teachers I've ever had, and I will certainly look to schedule myself in more of his classes in the future.

Best professor I have ever had at Ohio State! This class made me want to come to campus. He is the funniest professor out there and makes his class entertaining from start to finish. I will be taking more of his classes because he IS that amazing. Thank you Dr. Holt!
One of the best professors at Ohio State. It is not a difficult class if you are invested in it. Attendance is not mandatory but almost every student shows up to every class by choice!

Dr. Holt is one of the best professors at OSU. He's definitely intimidating at first, but he wants all of his students to succeed. He makes lectures entertaining, which makes the content easier to retain. Tests are very straight forward, so if you go to class and take notes, you should get a decent grade. Only bad thing is that he likes Minnesota.

Dr. Holt makes it clear he's there so you can learn. He incorporates real life things in the classroom to prepare us for what we'll see in our potential careers. He wants us to succeed, which is why he pushes us, and honestly, I haven't ever had a professor that cared that much. Loved his class and would definitely recommend taking his classes

He is by far one of the best professor's I have ever had. He is experienced and insightful. He's funny, inspirational, and pushes students to be the best they can be. He calls us future professionals, and treats us as such, not like children. You have to work for the grade,  but that's not what matters. Take a class with him, he won't dissapoint.

I took this class because it is in the Legal Foundations of Society minor, and because there is no textbook.  The experience I got was something I never would have expected. An awesome teacher truly dedicated to his craft and even moreso to his students.  My favorite teacher I had this semeseter.  Easy assignments no exams, mostly group projects.

Dr. Kraft is passionate and highly knowledgeable, but her arrogance often overshadows her expertise. She carries a god complex, making the class feel more about catering to her ego than learning. The coursework is doable, but dealing with her attitude is frustrating. If you prefer a more approachable professor, I'd recommend looking elsewhere.

This is a tyrant that is disrespectful and cunning for no reason. Hard work has never scared me however she does. If she doesn't click with you she will withhold things from you and disrespect you on the daily. She has a GOD complex. I don't appreciate her sarcasm because it is mean spirited and I'm not surprised that she made so many students cry.

I really did not agree with her style of teaching. She's one to be testing your patience with a lot of sarcastic remarks that don't land very well. There was nothing inspiring about the professor. I felt that if she considers you a threat, you will be a target in a bad way. I felt that most people fear her rather than revered her.

Nicole is very knowledgable about her field and it shows. She cares about her students and always tries to make herself available. The tough part is that her class is a "flipped classroom"; you do the reading and learning outside of class and then apply it in class discussions and projects. Readings are LONG, but you can get by with skimming.

Kraft made me want to reconsider being a journalist.  She is disrespectful and gaslights her students, and made me cry multiple times.  I am going out of my way to make a schedule that does not fit in my work schedule just to avoid having Kraft as a professor.  She points out your insecurities and makes them higher just to make herself feel better.

Nicole pushes her insecurities onto her students and it is very obvious. If you are interested in TV production or anything besides being a writer, she loses all respect for you. Don't waste your time in her office hours because she has an attitude and will make you cry like she did to me at least 6 times. I had to go to therapy because of her.

Nicole's lectures and real world application make her a great professor. Her abrasiveness and fakeness make her hard to love though. I learned a lot from her, but she also made me cry many times and question quitting the program. Her "encouragement" is copied and pasted to each student and she does not hold back from judgement.

Nicole has to be one of the greatest professors I have ever had. The amount of information you will learn is incredible and current, and she makes it very easy to make connections between class material and everyday events. SO INCREDIBLY UNDERSTANDING... I cannot stress that enough. She will do her best to connect with her students. AMAZING!

Nicole truly wants what's best for her students. She has incredible connections and wants her students to succeed in the journalism world. She does assign readings and projects, but none of it was too difficult.

If you'd like a professor that assigns random work that you don't know about until the night before, doesn't especially teach with her "inverted classroom" style and selects favorites yet absolutely despises anyone who reaches out for help, then by all means take this course! Heavy group work, meaningless readings and a hellish finals week.

Nicole Kraft was one of the best professors I have EVER had. She required alot of work in and out of class, but she laid the material out in a manner that made it very easy to keep up with. In class, she encouraged everyone to participate and offer their input to the class material. Nicole was also more than willing to help at the drop of a dime.

Dr. Kraft was an amazing professor that was very accessible and it was very appreciated given that we're in the middle of a pandemic. I have never learned more than I have from this class and it was refreshing to be in a class where you feel like the professor cares. Harsh feedback sometimes though so get ready to have some tough skin.

Nicole is kind of terrifying, but probably one of the most considerate professors I've had during this pandemic. Make sure you do the readings before class; you'll need it for the quizzes and for life, too. I enjoyed most of what we learned, it really prepares you for the real, journalistic world. It's important to keep an open mind in this class.
A great teacher who genuinely cares about her students. Also plays good music. Highly recommend taking her class.

Nicole is demanding but she is fair and cared about her students. You won't feel like your just chasing a grade, you'll have a sense of purpose in Kraft classes. If you want to become a better writer, you won't regret taking her class.

Do you want to learn to be a writer? Take Nicole's class. Do you want to learn to interview? Take Nicole's class. Do you want to learn to get connected to people who will help your career? Take Nicole's class. I've taken classes just to work with her and have never regretted it. You won't either. No professor will ever care more about you.

Nicole Kraft is one of the best teachers in the School of Comm. She understands the needs of students and tries her hardest to be flexible. Unsure where all the hate comes from. She's open and she's honest. If you're doing something wrong she'll let you know. Don't take her criticisms as attacks, because she just wants to see you succeed in life.

COMM 2221 was one of the most difficult classes I have taken at OSU but everything Nicole does is to help you become a better journalist. She expects a lot but she also goes above and beyond to help you get there and help you succeed. She has insane connections and so much firsthand knowledge. I learned and grew more in her class than any other.

I loved Nicole as a professor. She gave plenty of opportunity to receive a good final grade and was always extremely helpful. I actually enjoyed her lectures a lot, she kept them upbeat and interesting. By far one of the best professors I have had in college thus far.

I had Nicole for Sports Media. LOVED the class and she was a GREAT professor. Field trips, guest speakers, great discussions and fun assignments that we could actually get published She even let us cover an NHL game with her. She worked to help every be successful. I had no experience like it at Ohio State. Wish I could take this class again.
She was tough but I learned a lot. She prepares you for the real world. She also has great connections and will help with internships. Take her. You wont be sorry.
Nicole is the best professor I had at Ohio State. She is tough but cares more than any professor I had. You learn tons and she makes it fun.

Nicole is raw and authentic. She isn't there to just give you an A. She is there to make you career-ready and the A comes throughout the process. She is willing to work with her students and wants to get to know them on a personal level. The first half of the semester I hated her, but I realized she was actually helping me and my attitude changed.

Already regret taking 3404 with her a month in. She acts as if she is our employer, and we are to respect her as if she is our boss. This is a 3 level class- calm down lady! I don't want you to know all about your personal life, and you don't need to "reach" me.  Picks clear favorites, told a student he was her pet.  "hands on" but over the top.
Don't go in thinking it will be easy but it is totally worth it. You will get out of the class what you put into it. I would take any class with her again.

Com 4202. In office hours, she was not much help. Gave me anxiety attacks over grading, biggest pet peeve was that she would give you a chance to fix your articles and said if you follow any of the feedback comments given on articles, you'd get credit, which was untrue. Expect to give a lot of effort and time for little to no academic reward.

every day, you show up with constant anxiety about what random assignment you're missing. She assigns so much work and if for some reason she doesn't like you, you're done. i wish nicole the best but i would rather change my major than take another class of hers.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS UNLESS YOU ARE A JOURNALISM MAJOR. For those of us that this class is required, but are not journalism majors, it just doesn't make sense. She's a nice lady with good intent, but her "inverted" classroom style is confusing and doesn't have the effect that she thinks it does. Also, she considers this class to be a "job"....

She gave me multiple anxiety attacks over the course of two semesters, two of which were in class - and the second time, she said I was "out of control". She was the reason I changed my major - I didn't want to deal with her again. If you enjoy teachers who push you to the brink, this is for you. Otherwise, leave while your sanity is still intact.

She's great! There's a lot of work, but it's all relevant to the class as a whole. There's a quiz every week, 2 exams, 2 big projects, and 8 other assignments to help with the larger projects. She's pretty tough but only to make you understand the material better. She also goes out of her way to make sure her students are okay out of the classroom.

Nicole is very good at making you see the other side of things, playing devil's advocate with almost every point brought up. She provided very many opportunities to engage out of class and earn extra credit. She is funny and really has a passion for what she does as well as helping her students. Very sad she is not teaching 2221 this semester.

Nicole at first is pretty intimidating, but she just wants to push her students to be their best. At times the class seems overwhelming, but if you put in a solid effort there should be no problems getting a good grade.

She's just amazing. Helps you with everything, insprational, won't just push you out there without helping. It's not about the grade, it's about the learning. She has experience, she's tough but only to help you. Take a class with her you won't regret it, especially if yo'ure hoping to be a journalist.
Nicole is great! She was clear about instructions and the syllabus is very clear. This was the second semester of using iPads and it was awesome. I learned so much in this class!

My class was the very first class of hers to be taught on Ipad which turned out to be awful. I felt like the amount I put into the class was not shown very well in my grade. I felt like she stated her opinion a lot on what she liked and didn't like(ex:majors). When she said she was there to help you she was but wasn't able to relate it to you.

Nicole is great. If you show that you're actually there to learn and engage, you'll be fine. She'll invest in you as much as you invest in the class. You're gonna work hard, but you're gonna learn a lot.

The 1st week of class I thought that she was energetic and that it was an engaging class. However, she was extremely immature and consistently made it clear what students she liked and did not like. Students constantly complained about this. She would explain a project in class and then severely penalize grades for things not mentioned. Don't take.

I really liked Nicole the first week of class, but for some reason she really disliked me. As hard as I worked, it just seemed like I could never do anything right. I felt that I was continually belittled in front of the class and she had no respect for me. After she almost made me cry in front of the class, I dropped it. Then I changed my major.

I had Professor Kraft for 421 and 422 and can't wait to take 602 with her. She was absolutely helpful, inspiring and I learned so much from her. I have come to look to her as my mentor and could not recommend a teacher more than her. You will enjoy and look forward to class with Nicole!
Professor bends over backwards to provide professional/career opportunities.  You will get your feet wet - this class is the most applicable to the real world that I have taken at OSU.

The most useful class I have taken at OSU. Nicole takes time to get to know her students and helps give advice on your future career. She is encouraging and realistic about the field. The assignments are relevant and interesting. Take advantage of visiting Hoof Beats magazine for possible future internships.

Nicole was the only good journalsim teacher I have had at OSU. Not only does she KNOW what she's talking about, she will be there to help you in the future-internships, references, etc. She is the editor of a major harness racing magazine, so she knows what she's talking about. Follow her directions, and you will be glad you took this class!

best class i have taken at osu.  she's really opinionated, but is willing to work with anyone who asks for help.  genuinely cares about everyone leaving with the ability to write magazine articles and KNOWS WHAT SHE'S TALKING ABOUT. : )

shes very insightful, interested, and passionate.  she is strong minded, and blunt, but her straightforward honesty is refreshing.  this class prepares you, and for those of us so close to graduating, this is the kind of class we need
Great Professor! She has P.H.D- (“passed w/ HIGH difficulty”) 🤣🤣

Her class is super accessible to students. In her hybrid class basically every class is available in person but you can just join online no questions asked. It is mostly big projects but you have a lot of time to complete them and they all relate to each other so you can reuse a lot of material. Lectures very engaging too.
He is a really chill guy. Enjoyed his class.

Professor Francemone was great. He responded to emails fast and his grading was clear. Every week was essentially the same assignment, watch the lectures, take a quiz and write a 1-2 page paper. Then the next week you read other students and replied to them. No exam which was nice.

easy class. his lectures are pretty boring, just goes through slides that he posts, so you dont really need to go to class. you write about the same thing all year, so everything builds on each other. easy open book quizzes every so often and two presentations. would definitely recommend him

Seems like a good guy but lectures are very boring in my opinion. There was no class or group participation so it didn't really make the class super enjoyable, but if that is what you're looking for then take this class. Very fair grader, and workload is average.

The class was pretty interesting and the lectures weren't too bad. There's a quiz and DB almost every week but they aren't too hard if you pay attention to the lectures. He's a fair grader but your lowest DB/quiz grades are dropped. Overall, it's an easy class and Proff is helpful.
Large assignments about every other week usually. Very good when it comes to grading. Online lectures aren't bad and pretty informative.

Professor Kevin
Gives extra credit if you
Write him a haiku
Kevin was my professor during the pandemic. Best thing to happen to me during the crisis.
Kevin was the worst. 0/10
Professor Kev is Awesome ! Took us out on a field trip to the beach in Florida and had class in the ocean.

Prof Kev was very chill. Had some heartbreak during the semester so he lowkey got jacked and stopped caring about our attendance which was awesome. Taught us a lot about life though. One of those kinda men that you want standing beside you on your wedding day.

If there was ever a professor that treated students like family, it was Kevin. He brought fresh Brooklyn bagels to every Monday class. It's refreshing that someone cared about our learning. I hope Ohio State hires more instructors like him--they should have him teach a professional development class to the other teachers. Quizzes are hella hard.
Dr. Kev is one of my favorite professors at OSU. Hes super helpful in office hours and really cares about his students success. A really inspiring guy.
Kev is super awesome! Love this guy
My guy Kev is as good as it gets. He is so kind to all of his students and just loves to get to know each one personally and goes out of his way to be helpful. Take this guy if youre able!!

Careful on discussion posts - seems like if your work doesn't align with her opinion, you get points off even if all of the rubric requirements are met. Exams had typos/bad grammar and you never get to see the answers afterwards... questions are repeated on exams too. Did way to much work for this class just to have nothing to show for.

For a GE course, this was a good online one to choose. 6/12 discussion posts and 4/12 quizzes were dropped, so once I got past the eighth week, I didn't do any more work for the class (besides the online exams). A big downside was she never allowed us to see our answers to exams, so I never knew what questions I was getting wrong for future exams.

The class is worthless, Shulman sounds like the weakest link of an MSNBC segment. The final exam was RIDDLED with typos and sentences that grammatically made no sense, as a junior, Shulman was by far the least competent professor I've had, I spent way too much time on this class and I have literally nothing to show for it.

Did not watch a single lecture and got an A. The discussions are full on 2-3 page papers so I did the first 6 and didn't do more because 6/12 of them are dropped. Taking tests for a GE on respondus lockdown browser was kinda whack but this class is just busywork.
Genuinely did not watch a single lecture and got an A. Once I did 6 discussions I never did another one because 6/12 of them are dropped, and the di
GE course with lockdown browser exams? The class is common sense and self-explanatory, though. She is very biased and makes her political views clear throughout the course.

The class was pretty easy but some of the quiz/exam questions had more than one answer that could fit. Does not accept late work at all but 6/12 discussions are dropped and 8/12 quizzes are dropped. The class was very large so TA's were responsible for grading and the one i was assigned to graded discussions pretty harshly.

Very knowledgeable about the topics she teaches, but is somewhat disconnected from the asynch course so she doesn't feel like a very helpful resource. Generally pretty easy content, and tests are open notes, but there are a lot of "gotcha" questions or some that could have more than 1 good answer. Also comes off a bit condescending at times.

Everything in the class is common sense, Hillary loses credibility when she writes "Democrats/Liberals are equally receptive to info that either supports or contradicts their ideology, Republicans/Conservatives more eager to accept
corrections if in line with their attitudes; less likely to accept otherwise". everyone is biased, not just one side.

Took as a senior for my final GE credit. Automatic 10 point deduction for going 1 second over 4 minutes in a discussion post. Only keeps 6 of 12 discussions but absolutely ridiculous. Emailed her saying there was nothing in the syllabus or rubric about the automatic deduction. She just said she'll make it clearer now. Love the retroactive work.

Easy content, just a lot of work. The quizzes had a lot of "gotcha" questions that tried to trick you, but it's pretty easy to do well in the course as long as you can tolerate a lot of busy work, like reflections and discussion posts. You can tell she really enjoys what she does, and she works hard to make the online content engaging.

This class is a cake walk! The exams are easy (open note w/ 2 attempts) & the discussion posts are graded lightly. I didn't read the textbook, but I skimmed it for the quizzes & exams. You won't need to put in more than like 2 hours each week. No reason to not end with an A.

Content was interesting and applicable to everyday communication. The exams were difficult with true/false questions. Professor was alright. Lots of people whined and cried on the GroupMe, but as long as you read the textbook and watch the lectures, you should be fine. Negative feedback comes from the lazy students, so do the work and get that A.

I really loved her as she made lectures interesting and fun. The semester-long project was challenging but not impossible. I would definitely recommend her and would absolutely take a class of hers again.

hillary is honestly one of the best, if not the best professors here at the university! she only gives out information in class, so you have to show up, but she's hilarious so its alright. her classes are always super interesting and engaging, would highly recommend!
Going to lecture, taking notes, and doing the online assignments is all you need to get an A in her class.

Hillary is such a great professor. I had her for Comm1100 and she made the class interesting and funny even though it was a huge lecture hall. Plus, a super easy A if you attend lecture and study enough for exams.

Hillary's lectures were generally enjoyable and engaging! She doesn't post slides online, so going to class is all but mandatory. The only thing to be wary of is that the exams were the bulk of the grades for her class (at least the semester I had with her). Pay attention in the lectures and study hard for the exams and you should do well.

Hillary was both the best professor I've had at Ohio State, but also taught the hardest classes I've ever taken. She wants you to earn a grade, not get one. If you pay attention and contribute (which she encourages) in class lecture, you'll be fine. Make sure to go to office hours for feedback on assignments as it proved to enhance my grades.

All questions you ask, she can answer as "IT DEPENDS ON YOU". If we know it, why should we ask her.  She always said" i am resource for you" but I did not see any benefits.  She graded every assignments as lowest as she can. Don't forget this is a group project.  Other groups have the same situation. I believe a lot of people will agree with me

Very condescending when speaking to students. She makes you feel stupid if you ask her to clarify on anything and then sort of laughs about it. When someone asked her how to write a business memo she responded with, "Google it." She is very knowledgeable about topics but forgets that we are not, and that she is responsible for teaching us.

Loved Kristie. I took her for public speaking and she is so chill. Attendance is taken but removed from your final grade. Absence will affect your participation though. This was by far my favorite class ever it was a lot of fun and you have a lot of creative freedom.
Prof Sigler was great and really cared about her students and her class. As long as you go to class and engage with your group, this class will not be too difficult.

Krisite is a very nice professor who genuinely enjoys working with students and wants them to succeed. She has a passion for public speaking, as well as teaching it. I really enjoyed taking her class and have learned a lot about public speaking as well as overcoming my fear! Definitely recommend!
I recommend you to not take it unless you want to devote all your time to this class. she's nice but she doesn't have any alternatives.

Professor Sigler is a clear lecturer, an empathetic teacher, and does a great job equipping her students for assignments. She's a semi-tough grader but she always makes her expectations really clear. She's very understanding, too - definitely a professor who will help you succeed in her class.

Kristie truly cares about all of her students and wants to see them succeed. She is always ready to offer help when needed, whether in the classroom or personal life. She sets very clear expectations and gives amazing feedback to help you succeed on your next assignment. The class was fairly easy but you get out what you put into it.
Easy enough class, and Kristie clearly cared about the topics and each student's success.

Great professor, a very nice person. Make sure to go to office hours for feedback on parts of the big essays. The test was open book, but you definitely need to study and take it seriously. It was slightly curved. The professor wrote the textbook. Do the work and follow the rubrics and you should be good. Finish strong. C-REP extra credit too.

Professor Sigler is an incredibly nice person. Her class is very righting heavy it is nothing you can't handle. gives very good feedback and is very detailed. you should never be lost in this course. if you get the chance, definitely take her class

Professor Sigler is an excellent and very understanding teacher who was extremely helpful and willing to meet for extra help on assignments. The class was a little bit tricky at first but the exam was curved. She definitely sets up a class very conducive to learning, and one that allowed you to choose a topic for assignments which is always nice!

Professor Sigler was awesome! She is willing to work with her students through any troubles and gives great feedback on all papers/assignments. There are a lot of papers but they all build on each other so the last final paper & presentation doesnt seem so bad. Definitely recommend!

Professor Sigler is a great teacher. She reminds students that they matter and their mental health matters. Her class was great and none of the work unreasonable, but I know I could have put in more work on my end. In my opinion, make sure you are working hard during the first half of the semester, since thats where most of your points come from.
Kristie is so willing to help! She made this class both informative and enjoyable. You will become a better writer after taking this class!

Professor Sigler will help you become a better writer. Her assignments build on each other and she grades fairly. I went to her office hours for every essay (I highly reccommend doing this) and got an A on each one. Overall, a pretty painless 2nd level writing GE.
The exams are a nightmare, but the papers and presentations are easy. If you have fun in the class, you will pass.

One of the best prof's I have ever taken here at OSU. She really loves what she does and she is really good about it. Prof. Sigler really knows her material and will do everything to make sure you understand and hopefully apply that material in the real world. Just go to class, listen, and take notes.

She is a really A good person and very helpful but, Too much work for a second-level writing course. She grades extremely hard, so you have to go to office hours or you won't do well. Tests are online but they are tough. Quizzes are online too but they are not that hard.

Kristie is easily one of the best professors I have had at OSU. She is extremely knowledgeable about the course material and communicates her expectations very clearly. While the course is writing heavy, she makes it very manageable and TRULY cares about students and their well-being. She is such a gem of a person and I would highly recommend her!

Best professor I've had in college so far! She is very laid back, caring, and really tires to get to know her students. Class has a good amount of papers, but the grading criteria is very clear and she offers a lot of feedback. Other than that and a speech, easy and fun class!

This class is more difficult than it used to be, but Kristie makes this class manageable. She is very passionate about teaching and she really cares about her students. There is one time that she extended her office hour for 2 extra hours just to give help to every students waiting outside her office. Definitely recommended!
She was a lot of fun in class, though the papers are a pain. They build up on each other which is nice, and she helps you out if you go to office hours which is really nice.

Kristie's class has been my favorite class I have taken thus far in my college career because it is super helpful and she is so awesome that it just brightens your day. If you are uncomfortable speaking in public/want to improve persuasive skills and give this class the appropriate time required for a 3 credit hour course you will be very satisfied

She is a really nice person and very helpful but, Too much work for a second level writing course. She grades extremely hard, so you have to go to office hours or you wont do well. Tests are online but they are still fairly tough. Seriously recommend taking a different class if u can avoid this one.

Be careful when you choose this class. Quizzes and exams are online but super tricky. Exams are a bit better. There are 3 quizzes and 2 exams (Subject to change). If you do take this class, go to office hour because she tends to give those people higher grades. Definitely not an easy A, take Criticizing television if you just want an A.

By far the best professor I've had at OSU. Professor Sigler is very caring. Her exams are a bit tricky, and there are a good amount of papers. However, if you go to her office hours and get her feedback, you should be fine. Overall an amazing person

Mrs. Sigler is great! There is a lot of speaking in front of the class but it is comfortable. Papers are lengthy and take some time but as long as you put in the work, you'll get a good grade. In Comm 2367 I had 5 papers, 2 midterms (online), and a few quizzes (online). Would recommend you buy the textbook for the midterms and quizzes.

Kristie is amazing! It is so clear how passionate she is about the subject, and how much she cares about her students' success. She is great about making herself accessible outside of class, and provides excellent feedback. Can't recommend taking a class with her enough! I genuinely loved going to her class every day.

Kristie is absolutely incredible. She is one of the sweetest humans and wants you to succeed. I dont think the material is necessarily easy but she makes the lessons fun which makes them easier to remember. She is such a genuine person who wants you to succeed she is absolutely incredible

I absolutely loved taking Comm2367 with Kristie. She's an amazing teacher and the class is not hard at all. Pass your papers by her before submitting them and you'll be fine. She gives great feedback, has lots of energy and cares deeply for her students.
She is awesome! Best professor at Ohio State, and that's saying a lot since it's the biggest school in the country.

BEST CLASS EVER. Super interesting and applicable, super fun. If you get your drafts read by her before you submit, you are in the clear. Very easy A. She is literally the nicest, most caring and organized, best prof ever. Enjoyed the class, would take again. You can miss 4 classes without penalty. Just make sure you read the book--it's fun to read
Kristie really cares about her students and is very passionate about the course. Loved having her as a prof

Kristie is a gem. She is very nice, humorous and knowledgeable. Her lectures are relatively short, which will not exhaust you at all. And she cares about your participation in lectures. Her exams are tricky and hard, but if you read the textbook, it should be fine.

Kristie is an awesome professor. She really wants the students to succeed. Plenty of readings, but the quizzes and exams aren't hard. The final speech is a little stressful but the process of getting there makes it a little easier. A lot of research necessary for success

Shes a great teacher, I highly recommend taking her! There are two exams and a few papers. You do have to do a couple speeches, so be prepared for that. Kristie is always willing to help when necessary, and going to office hours was a big help in getting an A. Study the notes, the exams follow those pretty well! And the lectures are pretty fun too!

One of my favorite teachers at OSU! You learn stuff that can actually be applied to the real world. Read all the material, go over the notes, and you'll be fine. She can be a tough grader at points, especially for papers but she's fair. She's really helpful during after hours and some of her classes can be a lot of fun. Highly recommend her!!

She is one of the best teachers I had in OSU. Go to class, read all the material and you will know how helpful she is. Try to talk with her as much as possible if you have ANY problems. She will be will very patient to answer all your questions. I messed up the exam, which made me get a A- in the end. The course is quite hard. But u can learn alot.
Teaches stuff that can be applied in real life. Highly recommended.
Great professor, very friendly and approachable while still teaching effectively, this class does include a major public speaking component but she made the classroom feel very comfortable

This is the best teacher I ever meet, she teaches me a lot and it is also easy to learn. The assignments is a little bit challenging, but still can handle if you put time on them. Anyway, she is really really nice teacher and always think from the perspective of students.
The level of effort you give on papers determines your grade, as well as your performance on the only midterm. Great class and very enjoyable
Such a sweet lady, I would definitely recommend taking her! Give a good effort on papers and you'll be successful
kristie is awesome. wished i liked comm more so i could see her again one day. def hot
Very enthusiastic about class and cares about students learning. Shes pretty hot for a mom.
Totally awesome professor, probably couldn't find a better one if you tried. Fun and friendly and always willing to help! Really cares about students.
Kristie is really good! She is an easygoing person and patient to the students. She always encourages the students to do their best.I like her!
totally worth taking her class. fun, easy, and she's totes laid back. a kid even ordered food during class and she was cool with it. ahaha

Kristie is totally down to earth - on top of being a great professor, she's a great person. Class is boring at times but she knows to keep it short or otherwise we start zoning out. Makes things fun and easy! The beginning of the quarter can be overwhelming, but by the end it's all worth it! ONE exam!
Kristie is great, seriously. Take her!

One of the two best teachers I've had at OSU.  Had class as a sophmore, now I'm a senior.  Wish I woulda kept in touch with her - always willing to help and make sure you understand.  Took some stuff that could have been extremely confusing and not fun and made it fun.  Helped make everything all easy.  Very cool woman, plus she's good looking.
I think this is the best professor I've had at OSU.  You wouldn't believe how helpful she is.  She makes the class VERY easy.  No joke
She is extremely nice and helpful!

Genuinely the best and most memorable professor I've had at OSU. What you put in to this class has an incredible ROI in terms of what you get out. On the other hand, if you don't do the assigned readings then pray to whatever God you believe in because you'll need it. Her lectures are always interesting and her quirky humor keeps you engaged

I respect the hell outta her, she knows her stuff. Ready to help you if you try in her class. Funny as hell! Great mentor, super lecture heavy, you don't see your grades in Carmen, tells you why and is correct trust her. Think critically and ask questions, YOU WILL PASS.

Not an easy class. She cares so much. Gives great critical feedback. Prepares you for realworld/grad school. This is a critical thinking class, will not spoon-feed you answers but loves to engage in relating material in class to real-life application. Extremely helpful to students who genuinely try and will clarify anything you ask about.

She is the worst professor in COMM. Thinks too highly of herself and talks down to students. Tests are extremely hard and she doesn't bother to explain anything in class related to the material. Condescending and rude too. I cannot understand how this person was hired for this position when she can't even teach. Waste of time and tuition. Beware!

Jesse is one of the worst professors Ive ever had at this university. This semester and this class have been absolutely awful because of her. She never grades assignments and doesnt respond to emails- a COMM professor who cant even communicate. She still hasnt even uploaded final grades and the deadline has passed. Do not take her class!

She is one of the worst professors I have ever taken classes from. She doesn't care about students and has the worst attitude. She basically thinks she is smarter than everyone else and therefore constantly puts down students. Her class is a joke because her tests and exams are unreasonably hard so she can show she is smart. Avoid at all costs!

I'm currently taking her class online, and it's by far the worst online class I've ever taken. We have a month left and she hasn't graded a SINGLE thing. She's teaching HCI+UX but is terrible with technology and doesn't know how to use Carmen. I've had zero problems with other online classes so there's really no excuse imo. Avoid at all costs

Jesse Fox is a very interesting and entertaining professor. However, her essays and exams are astronomically unreasonable. I understand she's trying to develop us for the real world, but her expectations  are way too difficult for such a class. If you care about your grades avoid this professor, although her class is enjoyable

Professor Jesse is a very clear, engaging, and witty professor. She truly cares about what she teaches and she does so very well. Too bad her expectations were so high for her writing assignments, because she is unnecessarily strict. If you care about your GPA, avoid her at all costs if possible.

Jesse is, by far and away, the best professor I've had at OSU. She is also the toughest professor I've had. The essays and exams are difficult, but not impossible if you pay attention in class and actually study. She is also always willing to give great examples to explain concepts, and gives wonderful feedback during her office hours.

Jesse is by far one of the most knowledgeable professors I've had at Ohio State and she does care about your grades. Though she was one of my favorites, she is tough. She really makes you work for your grade. No technology allowed in class, at first I hated it but I was able to engage more in class.

DROPPED THIS CLASS BECAUSE OF HER! She is an awful teacher who cares more about what makes her happy than helping other students. WILL NOT allow any use of technology and posts nothing online. Don't think about missing one class because you will be lost. Expects perfection and will take points off of papers for the smallest thing. Do not take her!!

Video games class about how to write properly and nonsense theories most of which aren't geared towards video games. Also no idea your grade until the last day and all of the grading was left to a T.A. Avoid if at all possible about half the initial class actually saw the class out.

Personally I found her class difficult even when doing the readings, seeking help from the TA to go over my exam, and attending every single class and taking notes. For being a class about video games I thought I would enjoy this more and at least understand it but her expectations are too high for a undergraduate course.

She's not mean, but she's strict. She takes her classes seriously and does her job professionally and expects the same from her students. She'll help you if you ask for it but she won't hand you the answers or the A on a silver platter.

Although she doesn't take attendance, she does not post the material online. you're not permitted to use any electronics in class &if you get caught the whole class has a pop quiz. I found the information extremely interesting and enjoyed coming to class. She plays funny videos and puts memes on the slides that keep it interesting. loved this class

Worst professor ever! Teaches the class as an English class rather than a video games class. She is uptight and the grading is subjective. Video games class should teach you about video games, instead of expecting you to be gamers. Sadly, even gamers hate her class! She is evil, boring, and will make you hate video games

If you put in the time, and follow directions, you will succeed. She is a tough paper grader, but it is because she expects more out of an upper division class. She is very reliable, and very helpful. I highly suggest taking anything from her, as she is a professor that will prepare you for Grad. School and beyond.

Good lecturer in terms of interweaving fun stories into lecture.  My experience is that she is pretty unhelpful on the individual student basis.  I feel she holds extremely dogmatic approaches to teaching some of the subject matter.  Just because the instructor believes a certain way does not make that absolute truth.

DMAC failed to show dedication based on his passive aggressive approach to criticism and lack of creative encouragement. I expected material to cover Media, Marketing, and Communication but was met with AI, Media, and more AI. I hope to see emphasis on student creativity instead of encouraging ChatGPT and more variation in course material.

We used AI way too much in this class, I get that its becoming more sophisticated but we used it so much that there was no intellectual stimulus required to complete a majority of the assignments. I also think there was way to many assignments given in this course for it to be considered one credit hour.
Easy class, David was extremely nice and wants to get to know his students. He made the class more fun by how he taught and his personality.
This professor never cares about teaching or students.

She was a fair professor overall. Material was somewhat easy, and there was a group project at the end that was done over Zoom. She took feedback on the midterm after seeing the low average but only curved one question. She seemed to genuinely like what she was teaching, and the assignments each week were easy. Exams were kind of difficult though.

Dr. Kline is the most genuine and caring professor I have had at OSU. She expects the very best from all her students. She grades hard, but leaves line-by-line feedback and is very fast at grading (sometimes the next morning). You can revise anything you turn in, so if you put in some effort you will do fine in the class.

I took Professor Kline's class this semester to fulfill a GE requirement. I thoroughly enjoyed this course. While her lectures were often boring, they were relevant to what we were working on in class, and were helpful. Despite being a tough grader, she gives extremely helpful feedback. As long as effort is put in, she'll take notice.

Very helpful professor, but unclear at times. I had to work for the grade I received in class when I went in thinking that it would be an easy GE. She's more than willing to help and has open office hours and opportunities for revision, but she is a very tough grader and expects the most out of you. Get ready to work, but hard work pays off.

This class, Language and Social Interaction, was not at all what it seemed to be. It became a speech and debate class with over half of the coursework centered around our debates. She's a tough grader but gives the option to edit and revise your work. I didn't take away anything from this class and wouldn't recommend it to anyone as an elective.

comm3629 was absolutely not what i thought it would be... a speech and debate class. wasn't too thrilled about this, especially as dr. kline is a tough grader and the structure of debate makes little sense from her lectures. however, she always gives the opportunity to make up points, which is nice.

Dr. Kline is awesome. I got an A in her class and I am taking another with her! She is definitely tough - but it's college get used to it! If you are a Comm major she will be inspiring to you! She really knows what she is talking about and is VERY energetic. If you don't like to work for your grade, or don't like comm... pick another course folks.

This woman contradicts herself left and right. For a Doctor in communications she seems to lack the ability to communicate clearly and with a matter of consistency. I've gone in for help on more than several occasions for writing papers and each time she gives advice that completely contradicts her prior critiques.

She is a DR. in communication and is by no means a good communicator! She is not clear in her expectations about projects and papers, completely unorganized! Study guides for tests were enormous and not helpful. Exams are hard. She curves. TONS of reading. I felt stressed constantly in this class because I didn't feel like I understood expectations
Couple of reflection papers. Exams are hard but she curve.
She's awful. Unorganized, never bothered to learn my name and was terrible to listen to in class. Don't ever take a class with her!
unorganized, pretty weird, and impulsive.. dont take a class with her...EVER!
Class is 2 (easy) exams, 3 papers, and 2 speeches. Class requires a strong background in source-based writing. Overall, class was challenging, but work load was manageable.
Genius professor. I'll be taking any class she teaches. The material is challenging, but Susan's so full of energy and SO helpful that you really get into it.
do the reading for her exams

She's truly a marvelous professor. I got an A, but it is difficult. Homework is way easy, but tests are hard. Do the study guide, read all the chapters, and never miss class. AND, you MUST study the handouts. The essays for sure will come from these as will some others questions. I had no interest in org comm before, but she made me love it!

Very unorganized teaching style. I was lost most of the second half of the quarter. Tons of reading and notes/lecture notes/powerpoints. Tests are hard. She grades harsh on papers too. Would never recommend this instructor because of how unorganized she is... made me feel very overwhelmed.
Very interested in her topic. However tests were riduculous. 4 pages of study guide when only 5 topics were covered on the exam.

She's very into the topic and uses lots of examples to make sure you understand, papers are easy, tests are difficult but if you really study the notes that the ta posts the tests aren't so bad, very willing to meet if you need help and gives extra class time to discuse any questions you have concerning assignments
tests were unnecessarially hard, and the papers are graded very harshly.  not a good class.  I feel like I learned nothing.

She is so into this class and is very clear and uses lots of examples.  Readings not that important, but interesting.  Short papers are VERY easy just go by the notes she gives you, and final paper not as hard as it seems at first.  Take this class, she is a very good teacher and really gets you into it
best teacher in comm dpt. however hardest in comm dpt. learned most from this teacher, very helpful, very clear, exams were very hard though.
Susan Kline is a wonderful person and instructor. She is one of the remaining bastion of learned professors who are in it for the love of the profession.

I cannot think of anyone who does not adore her that has taken her class.  She is so energetic and full of interesting ideas.  That is not to say that she is easy.  You will learn a lot, and will gain a deeper appreciation about the many facets of COMM.

My favorite professor ever at The Ohio State. Sports Media Relations is a fantastic course for anyone interested in communications, sports, PR, etc. Tim cares deeply about ensuring we get the most out of the material and is willing to do everything he can to make sure you succeed. Three major projects but all are reasonable if you put effort in.

A great teacher and class. A lot of information to get through, but you'll be okay if you don't get everything done. It's an inverted learning style so  there's a lot to do outside of class time, but like I said, you'll be okay. 3 Major assignments to do, 2/3 are group. They are big but if you split them up you'll be ok. He cares a lot ab teaching

All semester, Graham's class has been the one I look forward to throughout the week. He is inspiring, caring, full of jokes, magnificently knowledgeable, and exceedingly intelligent. I could not recommend taking a course with him more highly.

Graham is so compassionate and kind, the man is an actual angel. If you have the opportunity to take a class with him, I guarantee you will grin the whole time. I could not recommend this course more.

Professor Dixon is one of the most passionate and engaging teachers Ive ever had the privilege of studying under. His lectures are both informative and entertaining, and hes just a generally interesting person. He has real experience in his field and demonstrates concepts in practical ways that make them easy to understand. Just do the assignments.

I took COMM 2596 with Dr. Dixon and loved the course and his style. I would (and am trying to) take as many classes with him as I can. Relatively few grades so assignments matter but he gives great feedback before grades so you'd have to try to do bad and even then it would be hard not to get a good grade with him if you just pay attention.

This class and professor were the most relaxed I've ever had. Lectures are always uploaded prior to the meeting time and attendance isn't mandatory. The movie review paper was straightforward and exams aren't too difficult. I definitely recommend this class if you're looking for something interesting and relatively easy.

Very easy and interesting class, Prof Nixon is really nice and accommodating. One paper as well as several weekly readings and lectures which are extremely manageable. Exams are very easy as well if you watch the lectures. Theres weekly assignments that are short and simple would def recommend this class.

Professor Dixon's erudition is wide. The components of entire course are simple. As long as you follow every of his lecture, it would be very easy to get an A. The lecture material is easy to understand, and most of the exam questions are based on his lecture materials.
One of the best proffesors I have ever had. He was very caring and understanding during this Covid-19 time. Definately reccomend!!

Graham is one of the best professors I have had in a while! He is younger, so it makes him more relatable. Actually enjoyed coming to class and listening to his lectures. He was really understanding with the whole COVID-19, and made online class a little easier on us. He is passionate about teaching and wants the best for his students.

Graham was a great professor. I learned a lot from this class. He is very knowledgable about a lot. He also really cares about his students and wants to see them succeed. He was also always so excited to teach this class which made me excited to go to the class.

Professor Dixon is one of the most chill professors I've ever had at OSU! He cares so much about his students and always makes time to help if needed. His lectures and in-class assignments are super interesting and he always knows how to make the class enjoyable. Readings are all online and can be lengthy. Show up, take notes & study  A or higher

I'm taking Comm & Decision Making right now and it is hands down one of my favorite classes I've taken at OSU. Professor Dixon makes funny remarks throughout the class, which makes it enjoyable to go to. The attendance is based on random in-class assignments, which are always interesting. He is relatable and gives great examples for course topics.

I was very bored by the content taught in this class but this is because I took it as a GE, I am not interested in communication. Graham is passionate about what he teaches and grading in the course is very easy. Attendence (in the form of participation grade in class activities) is 25% of the grade.

This is by far my favorite COMM elective I've taken so far. You can tell that Graham really cares about the material and makes it interesting. 3 exams with your lowest score dropped (most people only end up taking the first two) and 1 essay toward the end of the course. If you're looking for a comm elective, take this class! Really enjoyed it

Graham is great! You can tell he really cares about what he's teaching, and although his lectures consist of a lot of information they always seemed to go pretty quickly. The class is only graded by a few tests, in-class assignments, and one big paper at the end, but he drops your lowest exam score which makes it pretty easy to get a decent grade.

Professor Dixon is a very dry lecturer and data is not current. He is funny at times. He is new to the University so it could have been nerves. He is generous in his grading. He does in class activities that are worth 25% of your grade. These are chosen at random. I took this class as at GE. Provides Exam study guides.

It was Professor Bailey's first semester teaching so yes, in the beginning things were a bit disorganized. But! She's a pretty easy grader, gives good feedback, answers emails fast, and her assignments are applicable to Strat. Comm majors. I took 2321 and 3334 with her and liked them both. Would recommend as a communications professor to want.

Professor Bailey is a kind person but is very unorganized and not clear with due dates. You work on a group project all semester but have a lot of busy work that's unrelated to the project. Some extra credit opportunities are available.

I had to drop this course bc my other classes were slowly dragging me out(only took it for a commtech minor), so I am taking it next semester, however, David is super kind and keeps lectures engaging(remembers names fast). David does not post lectures so you have to attend class(type your notes). Test heavy, but pure memorization, so go 2 class.

took this class online and it was super straightforward/easy. i'm convinced everyone complaining just doesn't watch the lectures or take notes and then gets pissy that they didn't magically retain the content. david is a fine prof. if you do the work and consult the syllabus you'll be a-okay.

AVOID HIM! The worst exam score in my undergraduate period. I withdraw this class since I cannot ruin my GPA. I even studied for hours every week to prepare for the exam. I took COMM2540 this semester and it actually a super easy class! He made the easy class much difficult! I am not sure what he want to achieve by making student miserable!

COMM 2540 with Dave was not difficult, though I think it was helpful to take it online. Exams make up 75% of your grade but are open note and aren't very hard.
