The application assignments sometimes take a long time for how much they are worth, but two are dropped. Dave was an entertaining professor that made me laugh with his use of sarcasm.

Took his class this past semester and it was the hardest class I'll probably ever take in college. I'm a junior. He's a tough grader on the application assignments. I struggled to get an 8/10 at best. I studied for hours for the final only to get a 64%. Lectures are boring and he explains them in the most complicated way possible! AVOID HIM!
Makes an easy class a difficult one.

I feel lik epeople who rate him low are either slackers or unreasonable and entitled, angry students who just don't get it.    David was a fair and reasonable professor, his lectures were involved and thoughtful.  Don't miss class. Take notes. Read. Study. Ask questions. Consult the syllabus. Stop complaining. Do work for your grade.

He tries to make simple content difficult, and he is a tough grader.  On top of being a tough grader, he gives no real explanation for why you missed points.   I really think that says a lot about a person; to me it is clear he doesn't care whether people pass or fail...

The class very boring and useless. You wont be able to pay attention in class because all you will be doing is taking notes. The information is useless to anything to what you want to do in life and David is BORING!!! I would not take his class ever again.

Received over 100% in Organizational Communication.  The tests are not difficult, you just actually need to go to class and read the book.  If you prepare and study the material you will be able to clearly note the "trick" questions on the exams.  Yes, it takes a lot of work to get a good grade, but it's definitely attainable.

Lectures are dull and unclear. Tests are nearly impossible and he pulls material out of nowhere. Thinks its funny to mess with students heads. I studied and read the book. I am an honors student and this class also ruined my GPA! Would never recommend him.

The worst professor I've ever had at Ohio State. Doesn't care about his students at all and it's blatantly obvious.  Very arrogant and like others said makes tests just to trip you up.  Would avoid him at all costs.

Do NOT take his class if you care about your GPA.  I'm a 3.74 honor student who ended up w/ a C-.  Went to every single lecture and studied my tail off before exams.  His exams are not meant to test your knowledge, it's meant to trip you up.  Hands down, one of the most pointless class you will ever take in college.  Have fun!

Honestly this class was ridiculous. As someone who makes the dean list every semester with a double major, working 30+ hours a week in a job and being involved on campus, I'm beyond upset that I got a 85% in the class. His tests are way harder than need be. He tries to trip students up with the stupid T/F questions. Worst class I've ever had.
NOT FLEXIBLE AND ACCOMMODATING TO STUDENTS NEEDS.

Class is fine then you show up to take a test and dude is like what terms can I make up that sound better than the strange theories I tought these kids. Just his tests are a joke they aren't ment to test you just trip you up.

So, I wll say that Deandrea is passionate about what he teaches. However, what he teaches, is the biggest waste of a Ph.D.  The class is terrible and useless. The first few front rows are lined like a Beatle concert with women who constantly strive to gain his attention. He also can be cocky and condescending.

David really tries. It's a big class, and most people are taking it as a required class, and he really tries to engage the class. That being said he is a little dry, as is the content. The notes are not posted online, and there are ( super easy) pop quizzes that determine your attendance grade. If you go to class, listen, and study, it should easy.

Class was easy, not very interesting. He doesn't post slides on Carmen (wish he did it would be helpful) but he gives good study guides for exams. Go.To.Class. Or buddy up with someone to take notes, you will need class content for the exams.

David is a really good professor overall and a cool guy! The midterms are fair if you go to class, and the quizzes are pretty easy! Watch out for the final paper though, he's a stricter grader on that then on previous material.

The material itself is pretty interesting. Like others have said, slides aren't posted online so you have to go to every class (or make a friend). The exam questions are pretty tricky (50% MC, 50% T/F). Four easy papers. Dave is awesome.. the class is interactive, we watched a lot of current video clips.  I would recommend.
David was a great teacher. If you go to class, pay attention, and take notes you should easily get an A. He doesn't put notes on Carmen.

Dave is laid back and friendly, and he gives the impression the first day that this will be a fairly straightforward class, but- the exams are pretty tricky. I think he's trying a little too hard to not be an "easy" professor, because the material doesn't seem too difficult. Zero tolerance for late assignments and no slides on Carmen.
Great class!

David is a really cool guy but, his class was pretty difficult. He doesn't post the slides online. He has a zero tolerance late policy for assignments. His exams are extremely hard and he forces you to know the material front and back. The first average for the 1st exam wa. below a 70%, but theres a bug curve, Wouldn't take him again...

If you go to class and pay attention you'll be fine. No he doesn't post his slides online, but it's easy to get them from a friend. You just have to actually study and open your book. He's really nice and willing to help anyone that comes to his office hours. His exams are a little difficult, but he has a huge curve.

There are three non-cumulative exams, two papers, and some quizzes. He never posted the lecture note on Carmen; everyone is busy to write down during the class. On the exam, there are a lot of questions about what we've WATCHED and DISCUSSED during the lecture. You will learn how to take notes effectively! I will never take his class anymore

There are three non-cumulative exams, two papers, some quizzes, and some survey for extra credit. He never posted the lecture note on Carmen. On the exam, there are a lot of questions about what we've WATCHED/DISCUSSED during the class. Probably you will learn the effective note-taking strategies. i won't take his class anymore.

Doesn't post lecture slides online, so if you miss class your screwed.  Lectures aren't terrible, he keeps it as interesting as possible.  Exams are very difficult, and it seems he attempts to trick or confuse you.  Probably wouldn't take him again.
Super fun, would absolutely recommend
Tom Stewart has been a very good influence on me during my college career. He is very well loved by all of his students and cares about their well being and education fully.

Easily my favorite professor I have had so far at The Ohio State University. Lectures are completely engaging, the course material is applicable so often in real life, and Tom is a genuinely caring, respectful, kind, and funny person.

Only class I look forward to being a stem major, so that should say enough. He is such a great lecturers and makes a topic like public speaking come s natural through his life lessons. Classes are broken down into 3 speeches, two easy exams and participation points. Absolutly love coming to his class even if I have class on south campus!

Tom consistently only uses 25-40 minutes of his 55 minute lecture period which I rather enjoyed. Also, you only have to do 4 speeches throughout the whole semester and it’s in small lab groups. Plus he gives tons of extra credit and double points for just showing up to class (especially on bad weather days!)

Tom does a great job at explaining the different aspects of public speaking in an engaging and comedic way. He gives you all of the tools you need to be a successful public speaker in any situation. His class has been one of my favorites so far. He is a great person and instructor!

Truly made public speaking a piece of cake. Literally. He brought cake to class a couple times. Giving the presentations in recitation was super laid-back, and Tom really reassures you over and over that there is nothing to be nervous about. Public speaking is a breeze for me now because of this class.

If you have to take a public speaking class, have no fear. This was as good as a public speaking class gets. You only present to 15 people MAX in recitation, and Tom tells you all the points you need to hit to get an A. I wasn't fond of public speaking before this class, but by the end of the semester I didn't even get nervous before my speeches.

This was a great class to learn more about PR in a hands on sense. We worked within our own communication firm (group project of students) to assist a local business. Turn in dates are lenient and there are guardrail throughout to make sure you are successful.

Tom is literally the sweetest and funniest professor I've had at OSU so far! He makes class fun and doesn't take it too seriously (in the best way). His teaching style is very effective and class time in AGRCOMM 3130 is spent productively. There's little work, and some days Tom will just decide to give bonus points for showing up to class.

For a public speaking class it was actually enjoyable. He really cares about all of his students and only wants the best for them in and out of class. Gave a little bit of life advice in each class. Even brought in cake for the whole class on Halloween!
Amazing class, even more amazing prof. He truly cares, and that is easy to see in his willingness to make the class as good as possible. LOVE TOM
A fantastic professor who truly cares about his students and gives many opportunities for extra credit and extracurricular fun.
I love Tom Stewart and everything he offers to the classroom, BEST public speaking class. He truly cares about his students and their success.
Caring, kind, and inspiring.  Tom is the best professor i have ever had! Very easy speech class, highly recommended.

Great teacher who always made lectures interesting and fun to attend! Very easy to talk to after class and outside of the classroom.  Really cares about his students- not only while they're in the class but after in life as well.  Recommend anyone to take this speech class.

Super cool guy who made class fun to come too. He joked around with his TAs all the time and they were just as good as Tom. Didn't have to put that much work into the speeches and we only took the final and midterm as a technicality, so he made sure they wouldn't trouble us.

Tom was easily my favorite professor I have ever had. His lectures are fun and he almost never goes the full time. He really wants his students to succeed in all forms of life, not just in public speaking. He really helped my fear of public speaking. He's always trying to give us life advice and he's truly a hilarious man.

Tom's class was by far my favorite that I've ever taken at Ohio State. Tom and his two TAs provided solid, useful information that may have just cured my fear of public speaking and I will use for years to come, but also fun and enjoyable lectures. You can genuinely tell that Tom wants you to succeed and will help you in any way that he can.

Hands down best professor i've ever had! I took 2 classes with him this past semester and they were my two favorite classes. Lectures are super enjoyable and he wants nothing more than to see his students succeed.

Best class I have ever taken at OSU. I would take it again. I recommend this class to anybody looking to take a fun class about public speaking. He made it easy to get over fear and I gained valuable skills I will actually use in life (which is unheard of, right?)

Tom is truly and inspirational dude. He has no skin in the game. He has an AMEX black car and a $70k Jag. (Sorry Tom if it was more, I didn't stick my head in to see the trim package.) He truly shouldn't be bothered teaching any of us, but he does so for love of the game. The perfect teacher to give levity to any questions you have in life.

Tom is a great professor and an even better person. He teaches lessons that can be reflected on throughout life. He is happy to help with career advice and suggestions, and is an incredible contact to have! He is humble and genuine, truly rare characteristics for someone who has experience the success that he has.
I. Love. This. Man. Best class and professor at Ohio State, by far. He will remember you for years after your class. A very good teacher and a great friend!
Tom Stewart is the best prof I have ever had at Ohio State. He teaches you life lessons that you will use throughout your whole life.
Tom is the man, best professor at OSU by FAR!!!!!

Tom is the best professor ever! He calls his students the customers and is willing to help his students whenever they have a question. It was a very interesting class that I looked forward to going to every time we had class. I definitely recommend taking this class with him!

Tom is THE BEST! He cares about every student, and treats everyone like the customer that they are. He teaches very well and makes everything easy to understand. Take this class! You will learn more than just public speaking!
this guy is the man

Tom Stewart is easily one of the best professors at ohio state. He doesn't just teach you about public speaking-he teaches you about life. He treats you as a customer who is shopping for a product and treats himself as a customer service representative. In his mind if you aren't learning something and enjoying yourself then he isn't doing his job.
Awesome class, take it.
easiest class have to go w/ in class quizzes but awesome class
Best class everrrr.  :)
Great class, professor, and TAs.
Tom is the most awesome professor at OSU. He really makes public speaking fun. I really didn't want to take this class but he actually made me like it.
excellent....one of the best at OSU..genuinely cares for helping students succeed

This guy is an awesome teacher, he's very helpful and like for students to actually learn rather than just sit there and stare at him.  The speeches are fun, and you look forward to going to every class.

Had long chapters to read each week. Contained weekly 1 hour+ lectures that was required to watch, chapter-based assignment, & quiz (drops 3 lowest), a multiple-choice mid-term & final with 1-2 short responses. Have to put time aside to teach yourself, flashcards help, lots of EX. Not best at responding, TA's grade everything. Can definitely pass
As long as you do the weekly discussion posts and quizzes, you should do fine. Tests are difficult but I still got an A overall while getting a C on both the midterm and final exams.

She uses honorlock and it would flag me for literally everything, you have to set aside a lot of time on your own to study the material since the tests are comprehensive. The tests are also hard and so is the grading for being a GENED class about communicating. Some extra credit but it does nothing.

Quite difficult for an online introductory course. It is clear that many students do not do well because extra credit is simply handed out. Assignments are set to be posted every week Monday mornings and are not posted on time. Lectures tended to be unnecessarily long and unclear.

I was nervous about this professor before, but after taking this class, I was genuinely content. If you are taking her online Comm 1100, be ready to do discussion posts and watch lecture videos. I would take notes as well and MAKE SURE TO STUDY EFFICIENTLY FOR THIS CLASS. Do not do things last minute.

she's certainly passionate about her craft!! i enjoyed the course content, but imo it says a lot about you as a professor if you and your TA's feel required to give the class 10-14 points back on an exam. "you guys should review your studying and learning habits"... ok.
awful and hard class, boring

If you want a professor who cares more about you cheating than your mental well-being, take this class! Genuinely believe this class is a social experiment because how is it possible to make an introductory course this hard. Dr. Partain if you read these reviews, sorry not sorry.

Dr. Partain seems like a nice person, but makes an intro class so unnecessarily hard. She is more focused on students cheating than students understanding the content. As someone who is passionate about the communication major, this class discouraged me and made it unenjoyable. I appreciate the extra credit she gives, though.

This is the worst professor I have ever had. I am a senior and I would never take a course with her again. This class was mandatory as a communications minor and as a 1100 class I felt like I was taking a 5000 level class (which I have taken and has been much easier). Just be prepared for a lot of busy work. Do not take if you don't need to.

Laura Partain is the only professor I've reviewed here. She is the worst teacher I have ever had. She is focused on hurting students. Way too paranoid about cheating. Her lectures add nothing to the book (not sure if she understands the content) mind you this is 1000 level. I think she also lied about the content of an exam but I do not have proof.
Ruined my life
Bad, very bad. I should have seen her grade before I chose a course. There's no point in having a lot of homework and a lot of grading. Points deducted for no reason.

A weeks work consists of 2 chapters of textbook reading, a comprehension check after the two chapters, an quiz of the 2 chapters, 2 different lecture videos that require you to watch 75% for credit that can be an hour each that has meaningless unorganized talking, and then a written response where you compare the lecture to the readings. AVOID.

I really don't think teaching is the right profession for her. Disorganized, extensive readings that barely relate to the overall theme of the class. Very lazy grader, gives little feedback but gives harsh grades. Spends way too much class time talking about her personal life, not professional at all. Also the most millennial person I've met.
The most terrible professor ever. She never check the content of homework and just provide a grade rapidly. She never provides even one useful feedback.

The class was asynchronous due to her being injured. Weekly work included watching about 1.5-2 hours worth of lectures, smartbooks for two chapters, weekly quiz, and up to two discussion boards. Midterm and final were online and were many points. Extra credit opportunities at the end of the semester. Would be much harder if it was in person.
Took class online because she was injured. Class would be much harder if it was in person like it was supposed to be.
Do not take this class. Assignments are due at noon and she grades very harshly. She assigns a crazy amount of reading and lecture videos that take so much time.

Had a near perfect GPA, this 2000 level class destroyed that for me. The worst part, she gives zero feedback and claims she is “passionate about her students achieving”. It's all an act, nothing more than a con.
Don't take this class whatever you do.
I made an account to give her a 1/5 so that should tell you how she is

She was fine. Her lectures were interesting and the homework was like any other asynchronous class. My main issue was that you actually have to read the textbook for exams. The textbook is like A LOT too.

Never take it. Discussion can be deducted ( responses not deep). Each of the three exams can determine a big grade (four points can drop you from an A to B). Essays are heavily scrutinized, and a number of students I know, have been turned in to COAM.

She is absolutely awful, never take a class with her. The tests are extremely hard, no matter how you prepare and study you most likely will not do good. So so so many movies/films to watch and she is a hard grader. Gave us homework and quizzes over Thanksgiving break. Never ever take a class with her.

The lectures and online content do not prepare you for the exams. She grades unnecessarily harshly and does not provide much study help on the exams. I am a straight-A student and I studied for probably 2 hours and got B's on all of my exams which is ridiculous for an intro to communications class. This class was just unnecessarily difficult

Very kind, accessible, and helpful professor. However, the class is awful for a GE. The papers were graded roughly by TA's with no feedback to improve. You can't view exam answers/what you got wrong even after your grade gets put in so I had no idea what to work on for the future. Lecture slides aren't posted. I pulled an A only by doing extra crdt

I actually enjoyed the course lectures Dr. Grady put together, you could tell her passion for the content. Tough grading with the 2 papers assigned but all expectations were laid out at the beginning of the semester. Overall it is a tough course, fun content and read the textbook front to back.

They make you write long and stupid papers, grade them toughly, and don't even give specific feedback on them. The worst thing I had to do was write a 3-4 page self-reflection that was only worth 10 points. The lecture videos are so long even though this content can be explained in half that time. Such a meaningless class.

Don't take this class if you want an easy A, or an easy GE theme. This class is asynch, but that didn't make it easier at all. There's two bigger written assignments that were graded harshly, and took forever to grade. Discussion posts are weekly and are not that bad. And, Exams had pretty low averages for a Comm class. Not an easy course!

I cannot say this enough, please DON'T take this class. The content itself is easy but she makes this class hard for no reason. Lecture videos are excessively long, harsh grader that gives no comments, tells you that your paper lacks detail even though it's at or exceeding the page limit, and assign stupid 10pt self-reflections that are 3-4 pages.

Definitely do not take this class with Dr. Grady if you can avoid it. She is an incredibly harsh grader whose feedback on why she took off points is incredibly vague and always just tells you to "add more detail" even though the papers are already at or exceeding the page requirement. Getting grades back takes months.

I would not recommend taking this class. She'll take off several points for no particular reason/vague reasoning. If you ask for more detailed feedback, Dr. Grady will just tell you to go to office hours. You'll basically never know what's expected of you. There are multiple busy work assignments that are graded too harshly. Exams are also rough.

Worst professor I have met. Don't take her class. It takes almost a month for papers and exams to be graded. She gives NO feedback except keep saying like "write more details and examples". She requires us to discuss more in office hour instead of giving feedback by email or Carmen. It's ridiculous because it causes lot of inconvenience.

Sara was the worst professor I've ever had. I learned nothing in this class. The exams sound easy because they are open book, but the book and the lectures contradict themselves. It would take a month for papers to be graded and 3 weeks for the online, multiple-choice exams. Gave no feedback on papers and emailing her accomplished nothing.

Took 4665 with Prof. Bond back in my last semester Spring 2023. One of the best COMM professors ever! The class was essentially based on essays about research papers that were expanded upon during class. No attendance required but worth it since he went over good reading techniques and promoted awesome conversations. Would def take his class again!
Never attempt to argue with him even if you are right
Attendance isnt mandatory but he does quizzes daily for points for the people who do attend.

Pretty average overall. First paper is difficult because he hasn't yet figured out a proper maximum word count. Unclear about how to write essays for his class, but is overall an easy grader. Exams are all short answer and essay questions, but there are only two.

Dr. Bond has three PhD degrees and he gives amazing lectures. He is very knowledgeable and inspirational. I did not have any exams but two long papers and one presentation. The course will inform you how to do research and prepare you for graduate school.

Dr. Bond was one of my favorite teachers at Ohio State, had him for two of my Comm classes ( Comm 4554 as well). Fantastic teacher, gives great lectures and very approachable in office hours. Expect to do the readings he has a Top Hat quizzes ( for attendance and reading purpose) but they are not difficult questions. Not exams, highly recommend him
I find his lectures impressive, if not depressive. He encourages random "MCAW!" bird calls from the side of your mouth every now and then to break up the monotony of the everyday classroom.

Dr. Bond was excellent!  The in class lectures were relatively boring but the book readings were interesting.  There were no exams and he was super helpful when I went for help during office hours.  Would definitely recommend this class to comm majors looking for an easy A.

Bond is great. We had two papers (5 pages), a midterm, final, and some random participation points (which is basically signing your name on a sheet on random days he picks). He is a clear instructor, tests are fairly easy. The papers aren't hard, but do require some thought. He is very willing to help. Would take him again! also no textbooks!

Could not recomment Dr Cho more. She is amazingly kind, which shocked me as a non-communications major. Everything you need to pass quizzes and exams is handed to you. Just make sure to do the readings and go to class and you're set. I got a perfect score on the midterm with a day of study.

I could not recommend Dr. Cho more. She's a tough professor but she isn't unfair. ATTENDANCE IS GRADED! It was a little challenging but going to every lecture made the class much easier. I also suggest rewriting the concepts in your own words. It'll make them easier to remember.

I didn't understand what was going on the first day of class and remember being worried about what the rest of the semester would be like. As it turns out, Professor Cho is amazing and a great teacher! She doesn't try to trick you on exams or assignments, but genuinely wants to know that you understand the content and are learning.

Dr. Cho is a great professor. She really cares about her students and her class is very easy to navigate and understand. The weekly workload was more than manageable, the readings were relevant and useful, and the concepts from lecture were applied outside of class. Do your due diligence in this class and you will learn some great information!

Professor Cho is awesome! She is so interactive and makes it a goal to know everyone on a personal level. I loved her class and it was super interesting to take during the corona crisis. I highly recommend her, her exams are easy, her lectures are straight forward and she is awesome!

AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID. professor potocki might be hands down the worst professor I have had so far at OSU- I took this class for general education credit, only to find out that she is allergic to giving any student anything above a B+ on essays (the bulk of the test). This class should not be difficult online, it's the professor herself.

I took this course to fulfill a GE, but if you don't have to take it I recommend finding something else. She was such a harsh grader for a 2000 level course and gave little feedback. You pretty much work on small essays over the same topic throughout the entire semester then do a final speech over that topic. Overall I would not take this again.

Do not take a class from Bridget Potocki. Her grading is the harshest I've seen, and yet her feedback is incredibly unhelpful. None of this course comes from her. She sends out YouTube links to random people's videos explaining content, gives you textbook pages to read, and calls it a day.

This is one of the worst professors i've had in my whole life. For not being an upper level course, she grades so hard. It is basically impossible to get a 100 on anything. She outlines assignments very vaguely so you don't know what she expects at all. 
Overall assignments weren't hard, don't recommend that a GE find another class.

For some reason this class is WAY harder than what it should be. It was my lowest grade cause she's a very hard grader. The work volume is manageable if you keep up every week, but she's the worst grader ever and that's the only reason why my grade was so low. I would recommend finding an easier class to fulfill GE if you can.

Overall horrible professor. I took her communication class 2367 and definitely would not take again. She does not provide good feedback. In fact I took it with my roommate and she would give us the same feedback for both of our papers. She also a strict grader and never really gave anyone a 100 on any assignment that is not a discussion post.
Lot of busy work, but nothing too difficult. Concept maps were pretty strictly graded, exams were difficult as well. Required studying and planning ahead.
Overall, this class wasn't awful. There was a decent amount of papers and 2 speeches that you just recorded online. Clear guidelines but doesn't always give great feedback.
She assigns homework over break... AVOID!

Just read the syllabus and do the work the professor tells you to do and you will be fine, the class is not that bad at all. It can be a lot sometimes but overall if you keep up with it you will be chilling. The professor is okay, but it is hard to judge how good she is with an online class cause you barely see or hear from her.

Lectures she posts aren't her own, and the material is very heavy for an intro-level class, so be ready to be confused at times. Assignment descriptions/rubrics can be confusing. On some assignments, we would lose points if we were not "top of the class," even if the graders themselves acknowledged we had met all the requirements in the rubric.

I honestly do not know anything about the professor, as the lectures are not hers and she directs us to the TAs for help. The thing I dislike most about this course is that assignments are due during breaks. This is the only course I have ever taken that requires you to work during your break.

She actually uses someone else's lectures for some reason, so she's not the one teaching you the material. The quizzes, projects, and activities aren't hard. HOWEVER, Her tests are very difficult for no reason, and are worth a majority of your grade. If you have to take this class choose someone else! The average for tests is a D, with a curve B...

I think this class was pretty easy, not as stressful as my other classes. Although she is a tough grader on the papers she gives you the option to do revisions on them. As long as you do the work and don't miss any assignment you should get an A. Overall she's a good prof who cares about your overall grade and wants you to do well.
literally impossible to do well when she gives barely any information on papers and then slaps a C in your face for every single one. Good luck, you'll need it, that's all I can say.

The class was asynchronous when I took it. She did not create her own recorded lectures or questions and did very little work for the class. She was not very communicative, and when she did email you back, she was rude about it. Very unprofessional. Exam averages were very low, and navigating the course online was not easy. Would not take again.

Wish there was more consistency with the Intercultural Communication course with grading and timing on grading. Tough grader on writing which is fine, but wish she was clearer with what she wanted. Seemed frustrated that students didn't understand her method of writing. Was nice enough in person.

The class was decent. Sometimes when it comes to writing her responses can be rude and she doesn't offer much feedback to be better, yet says she wants us to improve our writing. Lectures were not straight forward and seemed all over the place. Felt like she wanted us to write like her. Class was okay overall

Mrs. Potocki is just a fine teacher in my opinion. The class is super boring and at times can be unclear. The exams are not very easy and navigating the tri-weekly group projects can be very confusing. I would say just try and be familiar with the course page on Carmen and read her directions very carefully. Not super helpful when you email her.

Not forgiving by any means. Does not teach any of her own lectures nor does she create any of her own material. Requires more CREP credits than there are available CREPs and does not provide an alternative. Unhelpful and mean when you email her for help. Most people struggle in the class and the exam average is around a 40%.

Bridget was super patient with me while I had a meltdown throughout spring semester. Let me turn in things super late without judgment, but please don't take her leniency for granted. She's an absolute queen and was a godsend to work with during the pandemic. 10/10 would work with her again.

As long as you were a decent writer this course was pretty smooth sailing. Prof has a dry sense of humor which I enjoyed, but was a bit difficult to reach outside of class. Would recommend this course to anyone as the assignments were pretty minimal (3 small-ish ones each week) and there were no formal exams.
Class is an easy GE. Prof is accessible but a bit rude and dismissive with feedback and accommodation. Just skim through and do the modules on time and you'll likely be okay.

The class is not too hard. A few papers and speeches, but she is willing to help. I always wrote my papers ahead of the due date and went to her office hours to discuss them and I always got A's. I got the book and used it on the online exams because she does not really go over that information. Overall pretty easy class.

Take this class if you can! You get real world experience with a real client. The class is a lot of work and a lot of out of class time work for your group project. This class will look great on a resume.

I learned a lot of practical skills. Did not love the group project due to my group but the class will not be completely ruined if you have a bad group. Mary is great at offering help and advice, for both inside and outside the classroom. I highly recommend taking a class with her.
I absolutely love Mary! She has incredible experience and knows how to best prepare students for the professional world.

This class was hard and your group can make or break it. It can feel overwhelming at times, but other times there is not much work to do. I really loved how Mary laid the class out and broke things up into sections. She is also super helpful and personable. Truly the best professor I have ever had!

Mary is by far one of my favorite professors I have had at OSU. She genuinely cares about all of her students and gives them great advice relating to both in class materials or a future career. This is my second class I had with her and I recommend any student to take at least one of her classes.

She is very knowledgeable about media planning. Is very helpful with group work and feedback. Weekly book quizzes that are open note. Exams (2) are difficult so make sure that you study. Has connections to possible future media jobs as well.

Mary is super nice and caring. It is obvious she wants her students to succeed and gain real world experience. I will say her reading quizzes are super difficult but it won't bring you down too much since there are so many points in the class. Overall, I would take Mary for 4337, she makes a difficult course enjoyable.

The entire semester was a group project-you have no say who is in your group. You do peer evaluations but I think it's just to make the students feel like the ones who slacked got a lower grade, but they aren't in the gradebook. I had taken her courses before and liked the structure-very straightforward. This class not so much. Quizzes 10x harder.

Great professor, learned a lot that from her that i can use in a future career. She is extremely caring and wants you to succeed, but you must be at class to do well! Weekly quizzes so theres no exam at the end so make sure to stay on top of those.

There are no exams in this class just weekly Proctorio quizzes that are very detailed. All the questions are meant to trick you and don't go into the concepts learned but rather the irrelevant details. The Proctorio quizzes are in place of an exam and if you do poorly on one it really hurts your grade.

Mary is a good lecturer but her quizzes and exams are extremely difficult. All of her questions are meant to trick you and are very detailed. If you don't know every concept word for word out of the textbook you won't do well in this class. Assigned weekly readings are impossible to keep up with and way too long.
Best lecturer of Communication major!

Mary is a terrific professor! I liked her a lot. She gets to know students well and is very caring. If you show up to lectures and participate, she will teach you what she is expecting from you in terms of assignments. Great class and a great atmosphere to be in when she's teaching. I would definitely any of her other classes again!

I liked Mary! She seems to really care about her students and she is a fair grader. You just have to follow the rubrics and what she teaches in lecture to get an A. Don't miss class much because there are participation assignments for points that she doesn't let you make up. The online textbook is short and painless to read for the quizzes.

Mary is a good teacher. This class revolves around a group project which can be very confusing and a lot of work. Her exams are somewhat hard. Her grading is fair, but rarely gives perfect scores even on things you worked long and hard on. Overall I enjoyed taking her class.

Mary is a great professor, she takes time to get to know her students and makes the class extremely fair. attendance is mandatory but she keeps you very engaged making class time go by quickly. lots of opportunities to receive and make up credit. one of the first professors ive ever had. i learned alot from her

I'm really enjoying Dr. Liu's social media course, she's a great professor. The lectures and readings are interesting, and the assignments are all very reasonable. Uses Honorlock but allows open book, and gives some extra credit too. Would take her again! :)
Lectures were very engaging and interesting. Got off topic occasionally but it was always pretty funny so I'm not complaining.
He truly cares about his students and I would recommend him. you do have to try in the class to get a A

Dr. Grizzard is one of my favorite professors I've had at Ohio State. He truly tries to make lecture as fun as possible with really cool example videos and he's super funny. He makes everything easy to understand by giving real life examples or drawing on a whiteboard. Would definitely take another class with him.

Dr. Grizzard is a great lecturer! The class is long and can drag on at times, but he tries to keep you engaged, and he's genuinely passionate about the material. There aren't many assignments, and you can use your notes on just about anything. You're graded for attendance, but you have a number of excused absences. The textbook feels optional.
I took stats with Dr. Grizzard and he really helped us understand the reason behind the tests we do. He was very aware of the needs of the class and helped us all to succeed. Great class!

Great professor and great class! I was a bit nervous prior to the semester because of his rating here and I wasn't particularly interested in the subject, but he truly was kind, knowledgeable, and cared about his students. The first exam is the toughest and he will tell you that, but it gets WAY easier after so stick with it!

I'm not sure why people are dogging on Grizzard so much but I think he's pretty good. I've had him in the past and I like him more now than I did before. His online class is straight to the point - just do the work and you'll get an A. His quizzes and exams really aren't that difficult and they're open note. Content is easy to follow too.
Professor Grizzard's lectures are great, he explains things very well and the quizzes are easy as long as you actually pay attention to the lectures.

Avoid this professor. I took this class for fun & it was exactly the opposite. The material isn't exactly difficult, but he makes getting a decent grade hard. Multiple times, he forgot to upload course work to Carmen. When all students failed the assignment due to his carelessness, he did nothing to remedy it. He refused to drop the assignment.

Worst prof I have had in my 3.5 years at OSU... More than 1/3 of the class failed the first midterm, decided adding a 2 point curve would make us feel better. He also never posted on the syllabus or on carmen when the final exam was going to be until THREE DAYS BEFORE IT OPENED. Avoid this prof at all costs unless your looking to fail.

The professor is an incredibly boring lecturer. I watch lectures and take notes every week and still managed to get a D on the exam. After adding a curve, over 50% of the class still had a D or lower, he had the audacity to say the exam was "doable." If you are looking for an interesting elective, don't take this course. 60% of exam q's were math.
Do yourself a favor and do NOT pick this professor. Take that advice or leave it, but I'm warning y'all now!

THIS IS HONESTLY THE WORST CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN. ONE THIRD OF THE CLASS FAILED THE FIRST EXAM AND HIS SOLUTION WAS TO ADD JUST A TWO POINT CURVE ONLY AFTER EVERYONE COMPLAINED. MOREOVER, HE DIDN'T ENTER THE CORRECT WEIGHT OF THE EXAM UNTIL A WEEK AFTER EVERYONE TOOK IT! SO EVERYONES GRADE DROPPED DOWN EVEN FURTHER BECAUSE OF HIS INCOMPETENCE
He is not a reasonable professor at all. Switches up his grading as he pleases and the tests are far too hard for the material learned in class. Good luck.

Hes really funny, but can be unclear about what is important for tests. He seems to care how his students perform, and is really nice. I wish he would give more detailed review sheets, though. The lectures can be kind of boring, but I can tell he tries to spice it up with humor and interesting videos.
very nice...

Ashley is an awesome professor. She communicates the material very clearly and makes its easily understandable. As long as you show up to class and participate and pay attention, you should do well in her classes.

Ashley is a great professor and very caring. The class is very straight forward which is great since it is online. Be prepared to give speeches and get comfortable infront of the camera. She is very accommodating to student needs and very helpful through email. I would definitely take her again!

This was a very fun and interesting class, but the professor made it that way. I feel like had I taken it with another professor, it wouldn't have been as interesting. Overall very easy and she would pull up a lot of Youtube clips to help illustrate the point she was trying to make, which is always very helpful.

Super friendly. If you show up, you will pass. Some of the theories are confusing but she comes up with great examples to help explain them more. She also starts out each class with an open ended question, which I found really unique.
Super nice and super easy assignments if you pay attention

Ashley is the best prof I've had at OSU. Took her comm class and took another one of her classes just to have her again. Exams aren't hard. A few easy papers, grades really easily. Super nice, makes class fun.

Took her public speaking, so of course participation matters most of all. Gives you freedom by allowing you to pick the speech topic. The only thing that makes her class difficult is the speaking in front of people, but you get used to it. Make friends with classmates, its easier to speak in front of them that way!

Professor Wade was awesome. The textbook for the class was online and free to use through canvas. As long as you do the discussion posts and quizzes you'll be fine, the quizzes are also open note. Two exams and two papers, both easy. Just do the assigned readings and you'll pass.
Professor Wade is a great! She is knowledgeable and helpful in the subject material and is a very clear lecturer and made class easy to navigate through.

Took this class online as an elective (Critzg Tv ARTEDUC 2700 24).Professor makes essay's unnecessary difficult. I spent  more time on assignment, essay papers and discussion questions then I did combined for 3 of my other classes. If you work and expect to get your assignments/essay complete in a reasonable time DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!

The class is easy enough, but I feel this professor added unnecessary steps and difficulties to a relatively unimportant class. Also beware she's incredibly strict on deadlines and doesn't have a lot of compassion for students who may be struggling outside of class barring extreme circumstances with proof, something I didn't appreciate.
Never fixes or critiques your papers for you to improve on the next one. Has a ton of homework and mandatory lecture. AVOID AVOID AVOID.

Professor Henry is good, gives very clear instructions. There's weekly assignments where you fill in a word doc after reading research or other materials, it's time consuming but not hard. Overall, she's a good professor and it's a good class.

This is the second class I've taken with Dr. Kennard and she is absolutely amazing! She gives clear rubrics and instructions, and the class is structured in a way that made it very stress free as long as you plan out your reading accordingly. She is an amazing person and professor, and I highly recommend taking a class of hers!
She is a wonderful professor I have ever met. She's nice and very helpful. I will definitely take her class again.
Great teacher who wants her students to succeed and grades fairly. Classes are always interesting, and she keeps it relatable to students.
Expectations are not clear and on top of that she is a hard grader. Not super helpful. However, she does try and keep everyone engaged in the lecture.
Ashley was a good prof. The subject matter is extremely boring but she tries her best to make jokes and keep everyone tuned in.

Ashley is super nice and helpful. I always went to her to ask questions and she was always nice and understanding. She's pretty young which I think helps her relate to her students. The speech at the end isn't that big of a deal because all your work in the class leads up to it and builds upon itself. I would take another one of her classes.
Ashley is passionate about teaching the material in this course. She is patient and kind hearted to every student. One of the best professors I have had.
He is very knowledgeable in the field and has great insights! The structure of his class is a little unorganized, but overall he is a great person to learn from!

Dan Farkas is an incredible professor and person! His class changed the way I write and prepared me for a career in the PR/Communication field. He runs his class as a business, unfortunately in the real world there are no second chances. Attend class, take advantage of his working classes and ask questions. If you do that, you'll do great!

Professor Farkas seems like a great guy outside of class and I'm sure he is knowledgable in the field of communications, but his skills as a professor aren't great. I got useful info from his lectures, but it was hard to use for assignments, it didn't correlate with what we had to do. Very disorganized and cost me my grade for this class.

My biggest mistake of my college career was taking his class. He is so unorganized, acts like he cares when he does not. Will give you a huge assignment with little instruction and will mark off many points for little errors. He makes it hard to get an A, which is the most unfair thing to do to a student trying their best. Please double think this.

Just like other reviews, he is a respectable guy and was helpful for our class but his lectures were hard to follow, unorganized and his teaching is all over the place. However, he was pretty rude if you don't turn in idea assignments. There's moments it seems like he wants us to write how he likes, not for the course itself

This man's ego is through the roof. Told us that none of us are going to make it in the industry because we "don't care enough" and proceeded to walk out of the classroom at the beginning of a lecture. Rude, uncharismatic, and irrelevant to the industry. Even when he does lecture, it's a mess and unorganized.
Professor Farkas is a respectable man. However, he is a very tough grader. He is unclear, unorganized and his lectures are all over the place.

Farkas is the best prof in the comm school hands down. I took my first Farkas course my sophomore year and this is now my third one. I actually search his name when finding courses because he is that good. He has a highly respected background in various comm professions and gives the best REAL WORLD advice. His lectures are the reason I found a job
Very unclear and all over the place. Although he seems like a nice guys so I gave two stars.

Farkas was one of my favorite professors this semester. I had him twice and I would take him again! He actually cares for his students, and he makes lecture interesting and understandable, even though it was all online. He really prepares you for the real world.

I think Farkas was a great professor and I intend to take another of his courses in the upcoming semester. Comm 4337 was not difficult for me, if anything it was my group members that made the class seem difficult but professor Farkas was almost always available to offer feedback and he was very easy to reach. I would definitely recommend taking!

Professor Farkas is very funny and has passion and a background for the subject matter he teaches. With that being said, this was a difficult course. The instructions were unclear at times and knowledge of the AP style is mandatory if one hopes to pass the class.
Basically a remedial English course. Vague assignment descriptions. No logical flow between topics.

Pros: Funny, nice and understanding guy. He keeps lectures interesting. Willing to help and give feedback. Working classes for him to look at your stuff before you turn it in. Cons: You CANNOT skip class. Not everything he talks about is on slides. Vague grading criteria for assignments. Tough grader. Must know AP style well to get a good grade.

Dan is a great prof! Although his assignment guidelines can be vague, he is very helpful and will answer any question you may have. Attendance is not mandatory, but it will be very beneficial for your success in the class to attend.

Farkas is a cool guy but seems to be all over the place with everything. The projects are vague on the descriptions and if it is not up to exactly what he wants, expect to get a horrible grade. Class is fine but through out the course I and others had no idea what was going on in this class. His views on career sucess are not fitting with my own.
really vague in the assignment descriptions

Farkas came to OSU with a lot of experience in PR, journalism, and broadcasting. His experience shows in his expectations of his students. Be prepared to spend a lot of time editing your work! His lectures are enjoyable, he's a really funny guy. Come to class, pay attention, ask for feedback. You'll do fine in the class.

Even if you have a perfect or almost perfect score in everything else in the class, if you get a B on your final project, your grade will be unsalvageable. In addition, I don't understand why I got the B because none of my communication with the Professor was responded to. The rubric is unclear and the TA was awful.

Professor Bonus is one of the best Comm professors I've had! He is really caring & is really great at teaching! There is an assignment each week (either a worksheet or quiz), and they are really easy. The final project is also really easy and only took me like 2 hours to do. You'll really like him!

This class was actually so interesting and not an overwhelming amount of work. He explains the material extremely well and actually wants everyone to succeed. There is usually only one assignment due every week and they coincide with the lectures. The material is easily accessible and organized.
Thoughtful class layout that's easy to navigate. Course content communicated really clearly and the assignments were excellent for reinforcing material. Great class.

There is a project that kind of builds on itself all year, if you stick on track with that, complete weekly article readings and watch lectures you should come away with a good grade. I did not interact with this professor beyond feedback on assignments but he seemed very accessible and the class was pretty easy. It can kind of get dull at times.

Her class is pretty organized and easy to manage. Her assignments are kind of tie consuming so do not procrastinate. I would say she is a bit of a tough grader, but not to the point where you would fail the class. She's easy to get in contact with, so feel free to email her with questions. I didn't hate the class, but I would not take it again.

I wasn't the biggest fan of the textbook, and you have to read it in order to do well on the quizzes & exams. The lectures were okay; I wish they aligned more with the textbook though. The papers aren't too difficult & they are graded pretty lightly. The exams are on the harder-side, but they are open note.

Easily one of my favorite professors here at tOSU; I'm taking her again this sem. Her lectures are very interesting & easy to follow. There are readings each week, but exams are open book; I managed to get an 100% in the course by skimming most readings. Also, the tests aren't cumulative so it applies directly to what you learned that week. 10/10!
My class was asynchronous with modules to complete each week. The content was delivered clearly and expectations were reasonable. She was very understanding and kind, I would recommend.

Overall an okay professor, but this class had some ridiculous demands for an asynchronous course. Multiple lecture vids., multiple lengthy readings required every week. Exams were decently hard compared to the content we covered. Not easily accessible and doesn't really go out of her way to ensure that students are engaged.

Class was overall easy, just time consuming. Multiple lecture vids, textbook readings, quizzes, and a discussion assignment every week. 2-3 hours of work every week, which isn't bad, but not great for an introduction class in my opinion. Lynch is helpful and the class is easily navigated, however.

I have taken all three of the courses Dr. Lynch offered this past year (COMM3558, COMM2540, and COMM3513) and each course was a blast. I learned so much from watching her recorded lectures and the research project at the end of COMM3513 is so much fun. I cannot recommend Dr. Lynch enough - she is amazing!

Asynchronous, taken for Comm Minor. Prof. Lynch covers a lot of topics beyond the reading, which covers most of the information on the exam, though they can be a bit tricky, as well as some of the weekly quizzes. Weekly work is fairly consistent and I found the lectures to be relevant and interesting.
Well organized class and honestly not much homework. Easy enough most of the time. Weekly quizzes can definitely be a little annoying sometimes. Exams were mildly challenging.
Overall Dr. Lynch was nice, but I didn't enjoy the class.

I loved Dr. Lynch. Her class is relevant, and she mixes up the readings to keep things interesting. The workload is fair, as are the exams. The class is much easier if you use Dr. Lynch as a resource. She is so friendly and helpful. She has changed the course since last semester based on students' feedback! Definitely a painless online class.

As an online class, there is a bit of work to do, but it's not bad, just a bit of reading. Professor did a great job explaining topics and encouraged students to use their own experiences to understand concepts. Would love to have her again.

Lynch seems really chill! The weekly assignments, readings, and lectures are not bad at all for an online class, especially since it is her first time teaching it in an online format. Material is easy, but for some reason, I did somewhat poorly on the midterm exam, which is odd because all the other assignments and materials are easy. She's sweet!

For an online course it was pretty difficult. The average on open note (non-proctored) exams were around a high 70%-low 80%. Her projects and directions were often very unclear and confusing. There were a lot of readings and lectures every week that you can't do well without takin in-depth notes on. I wouldn't deem Dr. Lynch as very caring either.

Most least accessible prof I have ever had. If you work independently this may be a good prof for you. Cancels office hours often, moves them to zoom sometimes. Her tests are really hard, not sure where half of the questions came from. Watch all lectures do all reading. Way more work than a 3 credit hour class.

Professor Lynch makes a class about social media dreadful. Her weekly modules consist of at least 3 different readings with 2 lecture videos and then a discussion each week. In her syllabus, she mentions that posting and responding within the hour it's due, you will not receive full credit. Very tough grader and difficult exams. She isnt personable
Great teacher. Lectures are interesting and worth attending. Just show up to class and its and easy A. Try to take her if you can!
This class is extremely easy. With that being said, the lectures are worth going to. She is very caring and interesting. One of my favorite professors at OSU.

Dr. Lynch is such a nice, dorky woman and you can tell she takes her position seriously. The class isn't hard, but also don't skip out on reviewing for her exams or you might get yourself in a little trouble. Weekly online homework assignments as well as response questions and two exams. Can get extra credit by doing C-REPs. Highly recommend!

Katie is one of my favorite professors at OSU. She is super friendly and always comes to class with a smile on her face. The course involves a lot of writing, but she gives clear instructions and feedback. You can tell she loves teaching and truly cares about the success of her students. I highly recommend taking a course with her!
I really enjoyed having Katie as a professor this semester. She was very helpful and made sure everyone did well in the class.

Professor Thomas is nice, but this class is way too stressful for a 2000-level course. Attendance is mandatory, and you drop a letter grade for each absence. She changes the class format depending on her own availability/preference, e.g. going virtual or switching class days. She is a nice person but I do not recommend her as a professor.

Great professor. Lectures are very clear and engaging. The course had a textbook, but I did not read it and got 100+ in the class. The content is not hard, and I thought it was interesting. Basically, this class is psychology without the brain/biology part. Nic Matthews has fairly generous policies. The tests and quizzes are open note.

Nic is very empathetic and teaches the lecture material in a fun and exciting manner. He is very helpful and provides clarification and feedback when you ask for it. He is flexible when it comes to class attendance, if you notify him prior. Overall great sense of humor and makes even the most boring topics exciting to listen to. Great professor.

If you're planning to take this course, make sure to get into Dr. Matthews' section!!! He makes lectures pretty entertaining, is very organized, and is always sure to provide clear instructions and expectations for assignments. Only three big assignments outside of class, and if you go to lecture and comprehend the content then you'll be just fine!

Managed to make a class about video games incredibly tedious and dull. Exams are unreasonably challenging, grading criteria are super technical and harsh (-20% because I forgot to number my paragraphs 1 through 3). Do not take this class if Matthews is the instructor.

This class was pretty straight-forward and had an easy-to-recognize pattern. His exams are application-based but I found them to be 10x easier than the weekly quizzes. His lectures are great, and I found that by taking notes directly from the slides and answering the questions from the study guide, I set myself up for an easy A.

I really liked this online class! He lays out all the material and groove of the class, which makes it very easy to get the hang of. Material really is not that bad as long as you watch the lecture videos, read, and complete the assignments thoroughly. You can tell he knows what he's talking about, so the material is somewhat enjoyable!

Really easy for being my first online class. Some disagreed and thought his class was the hardest online class they had taken, but it's really not that bad. The workload looks complicated at first but he literally lays everything out in modules so you don't lose track. Probably my favorite class I've taken, course load-wise.

Horrible professor. Took his entry level communications class online and it was way harder than it needed to be. TA's are difficult graders too and not very nice. Unable to see what you get wrong on exams to avoid getting the same question wrong in the future. Do not recommend!

Prof Matthews is extremely average and the content of the class was as well. He was slightly less on top of things than he should have been (i.e. errors in grading quizzes, etc.), but the class is easy as long as you complete the study guide as you watch the lectures. Also, I didn't read the book and got A's on all exams. Overall easy course.

I took this course online. This course was not very difficult in terms of concepts, but doing the study guide definitely helps on the exams. The weekly modules Matthews sets up for you help you know exactly what is due each week and the workload isn't that bad. His lectures definitely help with learning the concepts more than the readings.

Took this course online. The concepts in this class aren't very difficult, but to do well on exams you need to do the study guides. The exams are not description based, and rely on real world scenarios. He does his best to relate lectures to real world concepts, and homework is typically not too challenging if you follow directions
Nicholas gives very ambiguous instructions (which makes life difficult for those taking online courses) and makes it a point to be inflexible. COMM 1100 is deceptively hard, and he doesn't help.
Worst professor you can have for public speaking. Choose another.

Very easy class, as the exams that were meant to be "rigorous" and were supposed to "take me the whole time" only took me half of the time allowed. The information is really interesting and his video lectures were very helpful, as he would pretty much only ask questions from the lectures.

Nicholas is very bad at trying to explain to students how to go about preparing for a presentation. Every class consists of him going through about 40 slides random information that shows up on exams (memorization based of stuff that is not really applicable when doing a presentation) One of the speeches I got lost and he deducted 70% Bad professor

Nic is about as pompous as it gets. Content of course is heavily dependent on textbook, so dont expect lectures to give any sort of new perspective. Acts like this class is hugely important and makes it a point to be largely inflexible when working with students.

Matthews is a tough grader when it comes to assessing presentations. His lectures are pointless and dry. Class consists of 4 presentations and 2 exams that ask you to regurgitate random bullet points from his slides. Over all I am disappointed by his lack of involvement and clarity when giving feedback. Avoid and find someone better.

Well, the exam is harder than I think so be sure to study together before take the exam. Easy A if you take online class because you can look for the PPT or other materials, but I think it will be a hard class in person because you have to remember all of the concepts and materials then.

The material was extremely interesting and he did a great job at helping us apply to real life situations and show us how relevant the content is. He brings great energy and it very thoughtful in how he teaches. There aren't any tricks on the exams or assignments-all based on the material covered in lecture.. so make sure you keep up!
without any reason.

Easy online class. As long as you keep up with it in the way you have to keep up in any online class, you'll be alright. Don't forget to participate in Comm studies, it's required and not frequently brought up
You need to watch the lecture videos to pass but the class itself is really easy as well as informational
The class in general is pretty easy, however the midterm and final are pretty difficult compared to the quizzes and the synthesis assignments kinda suck
It was a good class for a boost in grades.  The quizzes were nothing like the exams.  The exams were rigorous compared to the quizzes.  All other assignments were relatively easy.
It's a very dry class. Completely online so I expected as much but the lectures are just painfully boring. She wasn't a bad teacher but the class itself was just boring

Bethany taught me so much about journalistic writing and was really chill and approachable. The class was stressful at times because of the nature of it (writing articles on a deadline) but Bethany is a good teacher who cares about students' success. Overall, I had fun and the class made me feel more prepared for future classes in this major.

Since this class was online, I didn't interact much with the professor. The class was pretty lecture heavy and I was able to pass the class without reading much of the required reading. The class was well organized and she responds to emails in a timely manner.

I enjoyed Professor Barker's class, it was not too bad and the class was structured pretty well. She was very caring and seemed passionate about teaching the content. Some exam questions were a little confusing but overall they were based off of the content, the assignments were not that hard as well.

She is a good teacher, but I can't get used to her teaching style. Her lecture didn't make the rules of the assignment clear, so you didn't know exactly how to write the assignment, and she graded your paper based on her own understanding, even if you challenged her reasonably, your grade would not change. I had a very anxious semester.

I had Dr. Barker for Strategic Communication Principles and the class was fully online and pretty straightforward. The weekly work load consisted of watching 30-45 minutes of lecture and writing a discussion post. She provides thorough exam review guides that make the tests relatively easy. I felt like this course was pretty dry.

The two papers weren't too bad but definitely work hard because the TA may grade them harshly. The exams were really difficult though. We were given a class-created study guide to use on the exam but Proctorio was used. I would have definitely failed if it weren't for the provided study guide. Lectures are okay- she basically reads off the slides.

Not as bad as the reviews make her out to be. She is a tough grader when it comes to the one or two papers you have to write, but offered a fair amount of extra credit. As long as you go to review sessions, communicate on group projects, and read the textbook you will do well.

This is my second class that I have taken with Professor Barker. The lectures are just her reading off the power point slides. You will learn very little from this course but at least it's fairly easy. This type of teaching style is genuinely disappointing to see from a class at Ohio State.

I took this class AU2020 and she literally made no sense. I dont know which was worse- her lectures or her proctorio exams. Probably the exams because they are so long and it records you the entire time. She also does not explain very well, just reads off her slides and clicks next!

I really enjoyed this course content. I used the textbook for most of my learning, and then just watched the lecture videos at greater speeds. Sometimes the lectures for the week were just some writing and links to look at which was easier for that week. Finally, the final group project was pretty manageable as long as you have good group members.

I took Dr. Barker's 2331 online course during the AU2020, and the class was a joke. Dr. Barker presented her lectures from home, where she read directly off her slides on a barely visible television screen. Her test's use Proctorio and are unnecessarily difficult for an intro comm course. I do not recommend taking this course with Dr. Barker.

I took this course online due to covid. There were 4 exams and also a few papers. Exams use Proctorio. The exams aren't easy, so study a lot! She is helpful though and it isn't too bad if you don't think about the exams.

Her slides are very straight forward, helpful, and very informational. She made this class easy to follow online. Its mostly all weekly discussion boards with occasional papers. Theres also a group project in the end which isnt terrible. Exams are easy as long as you listen to lectures and study a bit.

Dr. Barker is very caring to the students in her class. She responded in a timely manner when I needed help with the class. However, there were times where the material on the quizzes and tests were not anywhere to be found in the lectures and required outside reading. There are extra credit opportunities that helped my grade in the end.

Bethany is a very cool and flexible professor. She is very approachable and will always be there when you need her. She's super chill and can make you laugh. For those who are pursuing journalism, this class really gives a great outlook on how it is in real life.
Great class! I improved my writing by taking this course. Bethany is so kind and willing to work with students. As long as you show up and participate, there is no reason you shouldn't get an A.

Bethany is a great instructor. I'm not sure what anyone else is talking about, but if you showed up to class, you were pretty much guaranteed to understand the material. She's a nice lady and even though the course material is pretty dry she made the class bearable. She also gives several extra credit opportunities.

This course has requirements by the head of the department, so these TAs have no control over the content. The online exam was all on the book, but for papers Bethany gave great feedback and answered all my questions thoroughly, and fast no matter how dumb they are or even if the answer was right in front of me. If you take comm 2367 take Bethany.
Does not explain things clearly enough.

Bethany has a pretty straightforward teaching style, but she is too fast and only reads from slides. Her TA was not in class and seemed very confused when it came to grading. If you politely approach Bethany with an issue, she gets defensive for seemingly no reason. The class was fine, just kind of wish I would've spent my time in a different one.

She is a nice person, but this class is so boring. She stands there and throws so many theories at you it's insane. You don't learn a thing, but at the same time you get an A. Most of the assignments are super easy and don't require knowledge of the course material so it's an easy A. Group project is a big part of the class so take with a friend.

Class was hella boring, and I didn't learn much at all. She's a good prof and cares about her students, but the class itself was kind of a drag and it was hard to care about. Getting an A isn't hard, but you more than pay for it with the boring material
Honestly Ive learned nothing from her class. Tons of meaningless homework. It is not hard to get an A but not interesting at all.
Toughest grader I have had so far in college. No leeway

Let me start by saying- disregard any of the poor reviews. The only way to do bad in this class is to be computer illiterate, or if you simply don't try at all. Bethany was extremely straight forward in this class. There were 0 surprises, sent multiple reminders. Don't need the book if you follow lecture. Also, doesn't hurt that shes attractive!

The material was not hard and attendance was "not mandatory" but if you skip class you'll miss all the in class assignments which are worth most of your grade. Material is all in her powerpoints and tests were easy. If you go to class you will get an easy A.
Doesn't lecture and reads directly off slides. Is unforgiving with computer and program issues. Would not recommend.

Nice in class but tries really hard to be funny with little success. One-on-one, he talks down to students and makes it difficult to have an actual conversation without making you feel dumb. Tough grader on articles, which is good, but doesn't give much positive feedback.

Spencer is a cool dude. He makes lectures very fun, and it prepared us for reporting for The Lantern in every class. He is very reachable outside of class and is very kind. Don't be hesitant to ask for help; he is very understanding and has your back. Don't be upset with how nitpicky he is w articlesit prepares us for real news writing.
Great class, and the grade really depends on your own work!

Spencer is a very nice guy and is passionate about the field of journalism. He truly cares about his students and their progress as writers/reporters. That being said, his lectures are terrible and made up entirely of random pics off of google. The class meets three times a week even tho we are only graded on our reporting outside of class. Weird.
If  you want to be a journalist, take this class.
He has a lot of experience in the communications industry, and is always accessible. He grades very fairly and cares about his students.
he is a cool and chill professor. Easy to understand and be understood. class was straightforward. Only thing is to stay on top of things as there is a good amount of HW that is not that hard to do.

I am not sure why she has bad ratings, I took communication and gender with Dr. Ross and I really enjoyed her class, it was interesting and had intriguing class discussions. I do have to agree that she does sometimes lose her train of thought and her lectures can be boring at times but the class is very easy and an easy A class.

I honestly enjoyed my class with Prof Ross. Although like the other reviews say it's a little hard to pay attention because of how she often loses her train of thought but it was still easy to follow the lectures. Overall it was pretty easy and not a bad time.

Worst professor I have ever had. She loses track so often she cannot even articulate a single point in her lecture. All I hear her saying is "umm" and I cannot sit through a lecture. She does not know how to work Zoom and will spend the class trying to figure it out. She gives 2 days to do homework and grades hard even though she taught u nothing.

Felecia is great; her assignments & tests are simple and she usually doesn't give an less than a B. She's very understanding of schedule conflicts, and tries her best to make the class a breeze. Would 100% recommend her.

Felecia Ross was a good professor in terms of level of difficulty, attendance is taken so you have to go, but her lectures were extremely difficult to listen to as she loses her train of thought often. Felecia is nice and understanding, grades easily, and there are not a ton of assignments.

She has pretty vague guidelines for assignments and does not always fully answer students' questions. Boring lectures. Is one of those teachers that has a hard time figuring out Carmen. A very tough grader on AP style. Gives chances for revisions on all assignments. Not the best, but if you go to class and put in effort you'll be okay.

Dr. Ross was the most concise, to-the-point professor I've ever had. It was refreshing. She didn't blab on and on about her opinions and personal life like so many professors love to do. She was informative, helpful, assignments were clear-cut and simple, and class almost always got out early. Highly recommend.
She would always give me lower scores than the people I would work with on homeworks. Even if we had the exact same answers. She just didn't like me I guess.

She was absolutely the warmest most helpful and fun teacher I have ever had. I really felt like I was learning a lot, but was not at all overwhelmed. She was so easy to talk to and was genuinely interested in helping her students. She even gave us an un-prompted extention on our final paper. I just loved her. Reall an amazing woman.

Great lady. Super nice and friendly! She is always willing and looking to help if you need it. Have to go to class to do exercises but its nice because you typically don't have any homework :) easy class.

She was a good professor. I got an A in her class so I can't complain. Material was a little dry and class got boring, but she was a good professor. Go to her office hours if need be, she is INCREDIBLY helpful there.

I really like her as a professor. She wasn't a difficult grader at all, and when it came to the final paper she was more than willing to help and review it for us. With a lot of the in class assignments she was unclear about what she wanted us to be doing, but if you asked her one-on-one she was much better at explaining it. Plus there's no final!

Teacher is EXTREMELY hard grader. She would personally edit my papers and tell me everything looked good, and then she wouldnt even give me an A. On HW she grades really tough, and explains in little detail how to accomplish it. Even our TA is hessitant to help us because she never knows what Dr. Ross is thinking. She has a mind of her own.
I really enjoyed this class. Dr. Ross made a real effort to help everyone, even with the final paper. She is kinda hard core when it comes to grading but not unfair so just be ready to really try.

I had her for Comm 221. She was not helpful w/assignments unless you were 1 of her favorite students.  I'm a good student, attend class and do all assignments, and still it wasn't enough for her to fully answer questions I had.  She is not interesting and a little annoying.  The class was easy but I wish I would have taken it with someone else.

dr ross was very nice and tried hard to make things interesting and to keep the class involved with discussions.  assignments weren't too incredibly hard, and the exam questions came straight off of a study guide she gave us.  keep up with reading and assignments and you should do well.
she was a bit confusing at times, very nice lady but her tests were a killer, and not much like the material we studied
Interesting class, goes by quickly, tests are fairly easy, doesn't require a whole lot of work - just 1 short paper and one regular paper.

Really engaging, especially for an online class. There were no exams, which is great, and the quizzes were very straightforward. As long as you read and watch the lectures, you will do fine. There is a lot of busy work, but none of it was a hassle, and a few of the reflections were fun to do.
