Lots of writing, but a fair grader. This professor includes a lot of examples of Curb Your Enthusiasm, Friends, Seinfeld to apply to communication theory, which I really appreciated. If you put a decent effort in, it will be a breeze.

Prof. Nathanson taught Mass Comm and Society and was extremely accessible to talk and to answer any questions. We had nine, two-page reflections throughout the semester that was worth 55% of our grade. Very easy grading, as long as you used what you learned from the textbook or lecture. Very kind. Would take again!

The class was very easy and fun lecture videos. We watched clips of Friends and Seinfeld as well as Schitts Creek which made it really fun. Weekly quizzes with also either a short paper or discussion board. No exams either which was really nice.

Great class, assignments, and professor. This class was super easy-- show up, do your work, and you'll pass. She also provides very clear study guides for the exams. Therefore, don't waste time reading the articles and textbook because she will pull exactly what she wants you to know in the study guide.
There's basically a quiz once a week and two exams. Small paper once a week and long paper for the final. The powerpoints are way too simplified. It seemed like a waste of a class.

Nice professor, but the lectures were very outdated, seemed like she's had them since the 90s-early 2000s. Also 90% of the class is 3 exams with only 30 questions each, so if you miss a few exam questions, don't expect to get a good grade. Wouldn't avoid taking her class, but wouldn't prefer it either.
She is cool. Three exams and random participation. I do get tired sometimes and want to fall asleep.

Most common sense college comm class there is. Definitely would suggest taking her. She makes concepts super clear because she shows you examples from shows like Friends and Seinfeld. Didn't mind listening to her lectures at all because they apply to everyday life. Show up for class she does in class assignments that boost your grade.

Has random in class assignments. Short tests, which kind of suck because if you miss two questions you get a B. She's kinda boring, but not bad. Just an ehh professor. Also, don't buy the textbook she never uses it and even says her test material is straight from lectures.

There's only 3 exams with 20 questions (90% of grade) and 10-15 in class assignments, with the lowest 3 dropped (10% of grade). I wish she would have more questions on the exams, but they're not too difficult. Lecture slides are posted after material is finished. The material is kind of dry, but she tries to make it interesting.
Could not have asked for a better professor.

Class was boring, but extremely easy. Doesn't put lecture slides online, and has several in class assignments, so definitely reccommend going to class, but she gives a review sheet before each exam that covers everything on it. I got an A and never read the book. the only time i used it was for the 2 questions she pulled for each exam.

Easy class if you go to the lectures.  Her exams come directly from the slides she uses, but some questions can be pretty specific.  She posted the slides on Carmen for the 2nd half of the quarter so going to class wasn't as important, not sure if she will post them again-it was something new she was trying. Midterm, 2 short papers, and a Final.
If you yearn for complete uselessness, ambiguity, and slight stupidity...you've found your professor. And, I'm saying this having done well in the class.

such a nice lady! knows what she is talking about and keeps lecture entertaining and lets you out early :) GO TO LECTURE AND WRITE ALL NOTES her tests are straight from the notes but if you dont study or go to class to get the notes you wont do well!

I wasn't too interested prior to her class, but she made the material interesting and relative to everyday life. Take good notes because thats very important. Grade is based on 2 tests and a paper. I would take any class she teaches. She is very clear, and makes a class period go by quickly.
Very nice but material is a little difficult.  Be sure to go to class, take notes and study.  Book not really necessary, grade is based on 2 exams and 1 paper.
Very nice and helpful.  Class turned out to be more interesting than I intially thought.  No need to buy the book, all exam material is from the notes and lectures

You can tell Dr. Nathanson is very interested in the material she teaches.  Her classes are apart of the rare ones that I feel like I actually can apply the material to the real world.  Overall-good class.  A's in both of the ones I took: just go to class and take good notes.
No Comments
The class is about children and communication. Great, interesting class. She is very sincere- wants her students to do well. Also very helpful, especially when you are working on papers.

Nice, interesting class, though would benefit from being smaller.  Grade is based on two exams and a paper, but that doesn't mean it's easy.  The exams can get very nitpicky, but she is willing to help you out.  The TA was harder to access than the actual professor.
Nice class, a lot to learn but put together very well.  Dr. Nathanson is a very nice and sincere person, and very open to students who have questions or problems
covered a lot of material, but it was well organized

Dr. Nathanson is a very nice and sincere person.  She is a great listener and is available to students.  In class, she rarely talked or added to the discussion.  She had trouble moderating discussions.

Jasmine was an ok professor, her course is structured around AP writing and is therefore strict with that. Overall outside of class, she wasn't very responsive to emails, and I would usually have to talk to her in person about issues, questions, or concerns.

The course is difficult but she will give clear instructions to let you to follow step by step. She offered many opportunities to get extra credits that will help your grade a lot. She is willing to help and give useful feedback on your work. Comm 4337 is a group collaboration class, so good group mates are important!

Professor Roberts-Crews is a great professor at OSU! She is very personable and really wants her students to succeed. COMM 2321 was a very cool class and it really helps you in your writing and pushes you to do your best work! I highly recommend taking her class!

Professor Roberts-Crews is one of the best professors at OSU. She is caring and ensures that you have the knowledge and tools to tackle all the assignments. You will have to put in the work, but she is by no means a tough or unreasonable grader or professor. I would advise everyone to take one of her courses, especially if you care about diversity!

What I have to admit is that she is racist, and if you want to get a good grade in her class then I strongly suggest you change teachers. Also, she doesn't really listen to what you have to say. She has her own grading scale for course participation. Even if you attend every class, you still won't get a perfect score for your PARTICIPATION.

Professor Roberts-Crews is a great professor. She is very knowledgeable and one of the few professors who has an extreme talent in communicating material clearly and effectively. There is a lot of assignments in this class but she is usually flexible if you need extra time or help. Overall, she genuinely cares about her student's success.

She is truly a great person and cares about her students but she's a very hard grader. You need to put ur best foot forward at all times in this class if you want a chance at an A. Sucks that everything relies on a group project, but you end up with some good stuff to put on your resume.

This is an awesome capstone course. She cares about students in pandemics. I feel so bad that the second half of this course was shifted online. I REALLY LIKE HER. She wrote the recommendation letter for me when I was applying for graduate school!

Prof. Roberts is amazing. She genuinely cares about her students and wants you to do well in this class. The final project is a lot of work, but worth it especially if you want to go into a COMM related field. Highly recommend her.
The hardest class you will have as an undergrad in the school of comm. Taking this during a pandemic was awful.

It was a lot of work, but I learned so much. Disappointed that the second past of my capstone class had to be online because of the pandemic, but Jasmine made accommodations to a few assignments. She even made changes considering our mental health. What professor does that and is vocal about this! I commend her.

Professor Roberts challenges your thinking and makes you a better writer. Is the class hard yes/no. I say yes because learning AP style writing can be difficult but once you learn it which she gives you plenty of practice to grasp it, the class becomes easy. She cares about you and your success beyond Ohio State. Her class is worth it as is she!

Im going to give her a break because she did try to teach whats suppose to be an in-person, group project-based class online under short notice because of the pandemic. She is a little hard to reach but she knows her stuff and really tried her best to make sure students learn. She is more focused on the real world but I mean that benefits you.

Jasmine is a tough grader and somewhat arbitrary. At times the expectations and standards are unclear as well. It's frustrating to lose points on things that seem mostly based on her opinion. Mandatory attendance didn't seem necessary but she was flexible and accommodating if you needed it. The exams were easy w/ the study guide.

Jasmine is a very kind professor and has good intentions. She was hard to reach outside of class which was not very helpful. She cares about her students, but one thing that really bothered me was when she told us we could reach out to her on Twitter if we couldnt get a hold of her on email. Then, she told us its not good to use Twitter.

It's hard for me to really evaluate the class because we had to switch abruptly to online classes from in person classes. But I will say that I enjoyed Jasmine because she's personable and real. Yea she's a tough grader, but I knew that coming in. I learned a lot. She really went above to accommodate students.

Although Jasmine is a nice person, I would not rate her to be an amazing professor. I had high expectations for her as a prof after reading previous reviews on RAte My Professor, however I would not take her class again. She barely responds to emails and is very contradictory. Her work life balance means that once she leaves OSU she doesnt care

Jasmine demands a lot from her students. Easy concepts, but things in her lectures are unclear or contradictory, and then we are tested heavily on them. Exams aren't really a fair assessment of whether you know the material. Poor at responding to emails in a timely manner. She cares too much about what people would do "in the real world."

Jasmine was the worst professor I have had at OSU. She does not care about her students whatsoever. This is a capstone class so it is all group work and huge assignments. She will tell you to work ahead (on your 30 pg. paper) and then change what you are supposed to do roughly 10 hours before it is due. If you need a response to a Q?, good luck.

Professor Roberts was a good teacher in that she really makes you work for an A. The only book you need is the AP Stylebook. She is hard to reach over email before assignments are due so do everything in advance. She offers extra credit opportunities. There are AP Style Quizzes and other content quizzes, but she drops your lowest one from each.

Although I really enjoyed her lectures and believe that she has a lot of valuable experience, her grading style makes getting good grades on assignments very challenging. The group project is very difficult and often times cannot work ahead because of grades not being put in from previous parts. Make sure to study for exams!!!

Jasmine didnt really know how to operate an online class effectively, and it showed. We were often left not knowing what to do until the last minute. Furthermore, shes a tough grader; she rarely gave perfect grades and averages were usually a C. I wouldnt recommend taking an online class with her.

Jasmine is probably the best teacher I've had at OSU. She is always available for her students and really goes the extra mile to make sure they come away understanding the material. If you want an easy A than I would not go for this class, she will make you work for the grade and is a hard grader.
Super caring, and I can tell she genuinely enjoys teaching. I'm taking another class with her next semester and can't wait!

Jasmine was a fantastic professor who really helps you get ready for the "real world" She provided the text book (that she wrote) free to us. In class assignments and discussions are important, assignments are hard but the feedback is incredibly helpful. I encourage everyone to take her class because the advice is great.

AVOID THIS PROFESSOR!!! She Makes up your participation grade, gives out nothing higher than a C and says dont stress, professionals in the real world dont care about your GPA. The Only way you can up your grade is with quizzes, since they are not subjective.

Jasmine is a very genuine, supportive professor who allows her students to grow, and writing assignments are applicable to comm industry. Although there are usually weekly assignments, I never fell behind with her teaching style as she ended class with clarification questions/review. Many extra credit options and my favorite comm class so far!
Love her. Holds high standards for her students which makes it feel more like a real-world class.. Very helpful in the long run.

Love, love, love her! She teaches stuff you actually use! I feel so prepared for the industry after taking her class, but its a little frustrating that Ive had to wait until my senior year to take a class that I actually applied to the real world
If you can avoid this professor, avoid at all costs. Hands out C grades for full completion of assignments.

Jasmine is an extremely effective professor; she assigns material which will actually be relevant for future careers and makes you work for the grades you receive. She always ties in current events to each class, and provides an online textbook free of charge. She cares about the material as well as accessibility and affordability!

Jasmine is an awesome professor and knows what she is teaching. She is super educated and helps you all the time. There are many assignments and quizzes and she is a very tough grader. I have learned so much from her and can apply it to my future career, you should take this class.

I liked Jasmine as a person however not as a professor. It seems as though she makes up your participation grade(s) and never gives out perfect scores. Furthermore, this may be because I took the class during a summer semester but she doesnt mention upcoming assignments so you have to rely on the syllabus.

Jasmine was one of my favorite lecturers at OSU. Her lectures and textbooks (if used) are actually relevant and transfer to the workplace. She is one of the toughest graders I have had, but it is beneficial to those who want to sharpen their writing skills. She is extremely pleasant and is willing to help anyone who comes to her. Strongly recommend

I took three classes with Jasmine because I really enjoy her classes. The class were well-organized and prepared. However, her projects and presentations are difficult. She had high-expectation for each student so she's definitely a tough grader, but as a student, I feel that it's great to have an instructor that can teach you some real stuff.
She's a great prof! I learned a lot in this class.

Jasmine is a very good professor who was not only invested in what she taught, but she was invested in the students as well. She made the effort to reach out to the class about any job opportunities (internship or full-time) that she came across which I thought was extremely helpful. It is a class that really gives great hands-on experience.

Jasmine is great!  She really cares about her students and her assignments reflect real-world scenarios.  It is necessary to put effort into your assignments and class conversations to do well, but that benefits you.  Everything you learn prepares you for a career in strategic communications.  Overall, it's a really great and helpful class!

Her class is not easy, but I took comm2367 and comm2321 and both got A. Her class is well-organized and she always cares about her students. Go to office hours and talk with her! You will definitely learn from her and get a great grade. I would highly recommend her class.

The complaints below are super funny! Yes, Jasmine was tough. But she always encouraged office hours and stayed around after class, which I found extremely helpful. It literally saved my grade and I got to know her better (she's super caring). I got much more out of this class skills wise than I ever did by taking an easy prof.

On literally every assignment she grades a letter grade bellow what you deserved.  The entire class failed the BPS paper which is 70 points (worth more than any other assignment). I'd like to think I'm a great student and I previously knew almost every concepts taught and still, I'm struggling. I would highly recommend taking another professor.
Avoid her if you can.
Tough class, but helpful teacher

Jasmine is awesome! It's pretty clear she has a sincere passion for teaching. She's one of the few professors I've had that I felt really cared about students. She's also extremely knowledgeable! Although she's a tough grader, you learn so much from her. Take her class if you're serious about public relations and/or marketing.

She's an amazing professor and you'll really learn from her. The exams though would be super hard. The papers too would be hard to score on. Go to office hours, go to office hours and go to office hours. Only way to save your grade.

Very nice and is a great public speaker. If you are serious about becoming a public speaker then I recommend her, however, if you are just taking this class for a GPA boost, or because you need to, I recommend taking this course by a different professor.

Not the easiest second year writing course, since it is fast paced. But you are a comm major, you definitely learn a lot from her. She really is an excellent teacher and knows what shes talking about.

This class is interesting and fast-paced. Jasmine stated from the beginning that you must exceed expectations to earn an A. She encouraged utilizing her office hours. However-I did miss two weeks of class (mandatory military training). I did not feel like she was understanding at all, which made an already stressful catch up even worse.

Took as an 8-week summer session. Provided note-taking guides for most chapter readings. Lectures were few, pre-recorded by another instructor. Grading was slow, communication wasn't fantastic. However, grading wasn't harsh. Do the work on time and you'll be fine.

I never heard anything from this professor all semester. She must have had the TA's do all of the work. I know nothing about her. Also was less than a point from an A in the class, but she didn't round up.

Easy, interesting class. The modules are straight forward and interesting for the most part.  The exams are proctored and difficult compared to the weekly content. If you try you will get a good grade.

Since this was an online class, I didn't interact with the professor much. The class was well organized and she would respond to emails in a timely manner. There was a bit of reading to do for this class. The exams were proctored so be sure to focus on the lectures and do the required reading to grasp the material.

Since this was an online class, I didn't really interact with Professor Moyer-Guse. The class is pretty straight-forward: weekly discussion boards, reflections, and content quizzes, and 2 exams. Do the work and you should end up with a good grade.

COMM 3444 was a very well organized class and professor Moyer-Guse was fair in grading and listened to students. Wish the lecture slides covered more ground, but the tests aren't hard. All in all Moyer-Guse is a good professor.
Very hard to get an A in. Only graded on weekly quizzes and tests. You must read the textbook because her exams have a "reading studyguide" that are speciifc to texual content.

By the mixed reviews, she must teach better in person than online. She seemed personable but slow to grade and respond. One assignment each week & two exams didn't give any opportunity for recover if you struggle on either of the exams & it will affect your entire grade. Exams were hard. First class in almost four years that I didn't earn an A.

I was nervous to take her class because of the strict "no technology" policy others spoke on. But she was SUPER laid back, super kind and really great. She let us use our computers for notes and had a really fun atmosphere. Overall, really easy class. She gives detailed lecture notes and good feedback.
Pop quizzes. Heavy lectures. Very boring. Extremely slow grader. You won't get grades back for over a month. Would not take her again

I showed up late for my final in her class.  First time I've ever done that.  I walked up to her with about 90% of the class already gone, and she said "I don't care about why you're late, just relax and take your test."  I'll never forget that.  She could have said no due to anti-cheating measures and sent me away.  But she didn't.  Respect.

She doesn't allow cell phonestabletslaptops in class. This class was easy just make sure you come to class because the materials in class are the ones that comes out in the exams. Would def take her again.

Very strict no technology policy in a 200 person class. She kicked someone out of class yesterday for using their phone. Easy class, weird grader. She takes off points at random, it seems. I won't take another class with her.
Lectures were suuuuuuuper long and pretty dry.  But, as long as you receive your class participation points and study, you'll be well off.

Even though she posts slides online, half of the lectures aren't even on the exams. The class is extremely easy, though, so it's not hard to get a good grade. You don't need a textbook since all the readings you need are online. As a person she's very friendly, but it would have been nice to relate class readings to the lectures more.

I have taken classes with her two semesters in a wo, and I can honestly say she is one of the best comm professors to take a class with. She takes questions in class, will explain things to you and will be flexible with you. I really like taking classes with her.

She was so great! The class was super interesting and relevant if you are at all interested in media and/or kids. The powerpoints and notes she provides are directly correlated to the exams which are easy if you study for them using the slides and readings. She is one of the nicest professors I have ever had! Take the class!

She makes the notes very clear in class, gives lots of examples that makes things a lot more understandable. There were 3 exams, but as long as you study your notes and the book outline she gives you (you don't have to read the book other than going over whats on the study guide), and go to class, you'll be fine.
She is a great teacher! The subject material is boring but she delivers it well. If you go to class and read the chapters you will do great in her class! I would love to be in her class again!

Best professor I have ever had!!!  I had her for two classes in one quarter and she made life simple!!! Tests are easy just as long as you go to class!  Very helpful; lectures can be boring but she teaches the material very very well! Take her!

People really need to give her a break.  She is actually really nice, and as long as you study and go to class getting an A shouldn't be that hard! Yes, it is boring but so are half the other classes I take.

Managed to make the simplest concepts (survey methodology) hard. Ignored all emails during the quarter & passes everything off to TA's. Its obvious she doesnt know what she is doing b/c her long-winded examples made no sense to the few who listened. I lost brain cells bc of her..She made me want to switch majors & stab myself in the eye all @ once
Terrible teacher. Extremely, Extremely boring and she sucks. Failed many graduating seniors. Do not take this class with this teacher
don't take this class with her as your professor.  She makes no sense, just reads from slides then tests your on material that had nothing to do with lecture and makes grading impossible.
If I ever become a professor and have to design a class, Professor Bonus is who I aspire to be.

My absolute favorite professor. I've taken two of his courses and LOVED both of them. If you have the opportunity to take any of his courses DO IT. He really makes you interested in what you're learning and offers endless support and ways to communicate with him. Seriously, I cannot express how much of a great professor his is.

Professor Bonus is one of the best professors I have ever had. He is caring and truly care about his students. He made sure to always live meaningful feedback in every assignment. His lectures were clean and straight to the point and his homework was 100% helpful.

This was a pretty good professor to have online! Very clear with assignment due dates, making participation very consistent. Sometimes the class material was repetitive, but everything was easy to understand for the most part. Professor Bonus makes it very clear that he is open for any questions to clear up any confusion. Pretty good!

By far one of my favorite professors. He is funny, easygoing, & informative. Even though class isn't mandatory, you will want to go. Each class is a long lecture, but it is actually enjoyable & he always gives you a 10 minute break. You get graded on very few things, so you do not want to flunk anything. I hope to have him as a professor again!

James (Alex) is my favorite professor and I would definitely love to have him again. He genuinely cares about his students and wants you to do well. He doesn't make tests or homework unnecessarily hard. He is willing to help as much as possible to get you an A. Still have to study for exams a bit but they aren't difficult, uses quiz questions.

Take Alex if you can. He cares about his students and wants them to do well. He makes the class discussions interesting and is a really nice and funny person. He's also gorgeous. If you put a decent amount of effort in there's no reason you shouldn't get an A.

Alex really cares about what he is teaching and will help you if you need it. He is a great person and wants you to do well. There are no tricks, just go to lecture do the homeworks and you will get an A as well as a lot of useful information on researching in communications. Take Alex if you can.
She doesn't answer emails or if she does it is a week later. She is very nice and caring however shes ver inconsistent on posting rubrics, grading, etc.

Would not take this professor again. She grades very roughly and when you email her, she never responds. Has not responded to a single one of my emails all semester. Is not accommodating and doesn't provide enough explanation. If you have a different professor option, choose it. Do not choose this professor. She will ultimately lower your GPA

Tonya is an amazing prof. So kind, funny, and engaging. I learned a lot from her. I learned so much from her and became a better speaker by the end of class. Speeches are a lot of point, but she grades fairly. There are also discussion posts and short essays that are easy ways to bring up your grade. Best prof Ive ever had so far at OSU!

Best teacher at OSU. Ill recommend this course to everyone til I die. Tonya is a queen, shes always hyping everyone up and making us laugh while doing so. Ill miss seeing her once a week and Ill probably be one of her many students that continues to correspond with her long after graduation. 10/10 legend.
A really good teacher. I strongly recommend her. She assigns such a healthy amount of homework (the class is all online). Its the perfect amount to learn and still enjoy the class.

Tonya is amazing! I have loved this communication course. As someone who was worried about public speaking she makes the environment comfortable and her feedback is so helpful. She's caring and flexible as well. Textbook use was very minimal. No tests or quizzes just speeches and discussions.
She genuinely wants you to be successful in her class! She is a fair grader and lays out what she expects from you for your presentations. I wish all professors were more like her!!!!

Tonya is very nice and you learn a lot about public speaking. There were only 3 big speeches and 1 intro speech. Very easy bc its about anything you want. Assignments are simple and dont take much time. The 2 quizzes are based on lectures and common sense and its so easy to work ahead. I was done almost a month before finals lol.

I took this class as a hybrid, so half of the semester was in person and half was fully online. I really enjoyed the class, there was a very easy (if you read the lecture slides) midterm and final. We had four speeches to complete and I did pretty well on all of them. Really easy GE and easily my favorite professor of the semester.

Amazing. Show-stopping. Perfect. Exquisite. Tonya is a wonderful professor; classes are an easy A (unless you don't participate); she is one of the most flexible people to work with; and she definitely puts the well-being of the students ahead of classwork. I highly recommend!

She is a great professor! The class is an easy A as long as you put in effort for your speeches. I truly learned how to be a better speaker, and I am grateful for this class. She says the textbook is required, but you are fine without it.

One of the best teachers I've ever had. Professor Forsythe is there to help students grow and succeed. She creates a learning environment that makes students feel like they are all "in this together" and ensures that everyone feels comfortable in the class. She also gives really good feedback and is always willing to work/talk with you.
A wonderful heart and very clear path to getting an A. Always there to help and really makes you a better speaker - seriously.
Take the online class. Easy A
Super easy going. Only a few speeches and a few online tests. Class is an easy A as long as you show up on speech days.
Great professor and really easy class. Made public speaking/speeches easy to do.
All the comments below are right- Tonya is great! She is so kind and truly just wants to help you become a better public speaker. Follow the rubrics for the speeches and you'll get an A.
Love Tonya!

Really good professor. Actually wants you to get something out of the class. Grades are mostly based on your 4 speeches. Easy class if you put some effort into your speech. Just practice for a couple days and ask questions, come to class, and youll get an A. You have to earn it!
Easy class, makes public speaking actually enjoyable. Even if I felt like I bombed a speech and did terrible, I still got an A. Easy exams, no final. I would take as many class with her as possible!!
I love Tonya. She is a great person and totally down to earth. She is very understanding and easy to talk to. If she could teach all my classes, I would be happy.

I cannot say enough good things about Tonya. I DREADED public speaking, and she made it a thousand times less stressful. She really cares about her students, and honestly is just concerned with each student's own personal improvement. Four speeches, you can talk about whatever you want and she is totally unbiased. So thoughtful and sweet, love her!

Tonya is one of the best professors I have ever had in my college life at OSU. Caring, open-minded, and teaches students to be better human beings in terms of characteristics and ability of effective communication thorough her lectures & life stories.
Cannot ask for a better instructor for public speaking class! Learned a lot from her in terms of giving speeches and being a better human being!

Very funny and energetic. Non biased grader. Gives good feedback. I dreaded public speaking, but Tonya made it fun an enjoyable. I had anxiety about giving my speech one time, she let me give it another day. Very caring and understanding.

Best class I've taken as an undergraduate. Tonya was an amazing professor and looked forward to class every morning. She was very positive and wanted  succeed. Shared many personal stories to connect with her class. Absolutely loved her class.

Tonya is AWESOME. She's so nice and is very clear on her feedback and what she wants from you. She's more than willing to help you out on anything you need help with, and her rubrics spell out exactly what you need to do to get a good grade.  Attendance isn't taken but there she does randomly have easy pop quizzes to make sure people are there.

Absolutely one of the best teachers I've ever had! She gives you a rubric for each speech (which she actually follows) and doesn't sensor your topics. She's super laid back and doesn't believe in finals (4 speeches and 1 easy exam). There's a few pop quizzes and attendance points, but you'll actually want to go to class. TAKE HER CLASSES!

LITERALLY, LOVE HER. She is awesome. Best professor I have had at OSU. She is so understanding, super laid back, and wants guides everyone to do their best. You can choose any topic to write your speeches about which is interesting too. There are a couple pop quizzes, attendance points but she is super fair about them all. I would highly recommend

Loved her! I agree with everyone else that has posted. She's very laid back and funny which makes public speaking that much easier. Very willing to help and her exams were straight forward (provided power points). 4 speeches about anything you want. Would definitely recommend her! She makes public speaking fun= not an easy thing to do.
Shes so fun and easy going. Exams straight from provided powerpoints. Speeches about anything you want. Easy "pop quizzes" just to get you speaking in front of the class. Definitely recommend!

I cannot emphasize enough how amazing this class was. Tonya is so nice and willing to help you with anything you need. She is also hilarious, laid-back and just awesome. 2 tests, straight from powerpoint notes, as well as 4 speeches (easy) that can be about anything you want. I've never been in a class that was closer or had more fun together.

Tonya is an absolutely amazing teacher. She keep the material straightforward, she's funny, has extremely relevant examples, and makes public speaking fun and easy. She keeps you entertained with her fun family stories and greatly prepares you for the future. I LOVED her class.
Awesome!

She is super nice, and given that the topic is very straight forward, she still makes sure that you understand what she's talking about. If you need help, ask. She is more than ready to help you with any insecurities or misunderstandings. Wants you to do well in the class. Lots of experience in the real world, too.
Loved her class! She graded on your own ability to speak in public. I was very nervous and she was very forgiving. She wanted everyone to do well. Its easy to get an A.
Tonya is the most amazing professor I have ever had! She made public speaking fun and easy! If you prepare for each speech and quiz properly, you will DEFINITELY get an A.

This class was so well organized. I liked how the professor had fill in the blanks that went with the lecture which made it easier to follow along and grasp the material. The professor is also very kind and caring to the students. She will do anything to make sure students do well in class.

Prof Roselyn she is definitely the best professor I met in all my COMM courses! She is so caring and warm, I look forward to her class every week this semester. Her lecture is clear and will help you explain the confusing concepts really well. Exams are a bit tricky, but not so difficult if you take decent notes.
Very approachable and kind. Great lecturer as well. Nothing bad to say about Prof. Lee-Won; shes a delight!

I had to say Roselyn was the best professor I had in Ohio State! I took COMM 4555&4554, and I wish I had taken more. She was truly inspiring, knowledgeable, helpful, sweet, caring, and all the great words you can think of. I love her and she inspired me a lot in my interests and pursuits. She also wrote an LOR for my current grad school program :)

Professor Roselyn is undoubtedly the best professor I have had in college. She is not only sweet as can be, but also a true expert in the field and is passionate about the subject matter. She grades fairly and you can expect a group project to be a part of the class. If that's not convincing enough, I took 3 of her courses. She's that wonderful.
She is amazing. So kind and caring. I felt really happy to go to class. She's extremely easy to approach. If you can't do this class, you cannot do any other class.

IF YOU ARE TRYING TO DECIDE BETWEEN DR. FOX AND ROSELYN, choose Roselyn for HCI. She is such an easy grader and accommodating and really great about explaining topics. Group projects she is so lenient on. Clear grading and gives a crazy amount of extra credit that will bump you up a letter grade. Tests are tricky

He is an amazing professor, not the best lecturer but tried his best to keep lectures interesting. If you are ever sick he is very understanding and does not penalize you. His exams are hard but all of the questions relate to the course material, there are no surprises. He is very helpful outside of class, utilize his office hours!

Dr Kelly is an absolute gem at OSU. He goes above and beyond to make all students comfortable and feel like they understand the topics. He gives an in person lecture while also live streaming class to a zoom so anyone who cant come to class doesn't miss a step! He takes time to ask the people in zoom if they have questions and explains very well.
Lectures can get boring at times and he leaves very little time for class assignments. Other than that he is very accomodating and grades moderately hard. Great guy.

An amazing professor. I reached out to him when I was struggling with personal issues, and he was incredibly patient and understanding. The course content can be tough to grasp at times, but the hands-on way that the class is structured makes it interesting and easier to learn. I would highly recommend taking a class with him.

Best professor I've met at the OSU. He's the only one professor I knew that would take time talking about covid seriously. He's responsible to his job and I promise you'll learn A LOT from him as long as you take his class seriously. Must pay attention during class time and ask question even if you think it's stupid. He's super willing to help.

Among my favorite profs Ive had in 4 years at OSU. Dr. Garrett cares about students, loves what he teaches, & teaches it well. In 3545 last winter, he broke down COVID news each week, before it was on anyones radar. 4557 is tougher though, & very technical. In anyone elses hands, I wouldnt have liked it. That speaks to how great Dr. Garrett is.

Honestly, Dr. Kelly is a good professor but I really don't get what he wants to accomplish by making student lives miserable. He is smart I got but he should be more cooperative. he thinks he is teaching graduate school. Honestly, I would recommend another professor. His exams are ridiculously hard and confusing.

Loved this class, and loved this professor. He really wants to do everything he can to make sure his students understand the material and how to apply it. He made the material interesting and applicable.

This guy is amazing! I think the most important thing is that you have to actually be interested in what he's talking about to really get a lot out of it... he's always willing to help you with and clarify any question you might have! Would definitely take this again, or another class with him!

Kelly is the best IT professor at OSU. He is so smart and knowledgeable. He always had an answer for a question and it definitely would be hard to pass if you skip lecture. I recommend sitting in the first 2 rows and asking a lot of questions. Tests are hard but you are allowed the textbook. I would take this class over and over again.

Hardest class I've taken at OSU -- mostly in part to Kelly. His tests are kind of ridiculous, and he has trouble breaking things down into terms that make sense. The good thing is that with all the extra assignments and readings, he makes the class very easy to pass.. even if you do poorly on his exams.

Definitely the best professor I've had in my 5 years here. Kelly is very smart and super patient. Even though there are extra readings it's okay not to fully grasp the concepts because he will go over them in great detail in class at a very easy speed. As long as you show up to class an give a little effort you can get an B.

I took two classes with him. I struggled with one but easily passed the other. He really worked with me to make sure I pass. If you have him, make sure you get to know him so he will take the time to work with you. He is so smart, which makes it a little intimidating, but he really is a great guy. I would take as many classes with him if i could!

Kelly is an excellent instructor and this course is one of the most useful that I have taken in my college career. I have actually felt a desire to learn the material, a rarity for me. However, beware. The material is potentially difficult if you are bad with technology. He cares more that you learn key concepts rather than just memorization.

Had him for multiple classes.  Both classes the tests were very difficult and confusing.  He is the type of teacher who is very book smart but does not write tests well.  He tries to trick you on questions.  Even though he is a smart guy I wouldn't recommend him.  He expects you to spend majority of your time on his class compared to other classes.
Kelly is a sweetheart, he gets so enthused about information we could careless about lol but he does a great job up there!
Great professor. Read slides, don't need book. Read questions on exams carefully. 4 short papers. Go to office hours if you need help. Very manageable and interesting class
Takes attendance through using clickers. Don't buy the book, you won't use it. Just studies the slides. All MC exams, attendance, and 4 short papers. Pretty manageable overall

I am currently taking this class and I must say professor Garret is extremely helpful and he knows what he is doing. Study the slides and during the exams make sure to read the questions carefully they can get a lil bit tricky at times..Good class (don't get the book, I haven't use it at all and my current grade is an A)

I'm taking COMM 240 with him right now. Honestly, one of the better classes I've ever had. He knows his stuff and can make the class laugh with his dry sense of humor. If you're a tech guru, the class should be an easy A as long as you go to lectures and do your papers

This guy is pretty helpful. It's clear that he knows his stuff. Have to go to class since it's 5% of your grade. 4 papers are 40% (but they are pretty easy to do) and the rest of the grade is from exams. However, you need to study the slides carefully because he needs to do a better job clarifying certain questions on the exams.
Nice class, lecture slides provided.
The very passionate and like's to teach about communication technology. I find the class interesting an like learning how technologies work.

class is a little boring unless your very interested in technology. nice professor, willing to work with students and flexible forming office hours based around your schedule.. GO TO CLASS.. just because its a comm class doesnt mean its easy so take some time studyin! overall not too bad of a class
his voice can be a little dry but he is clear and thorough in his lectures.  he uses plenty of examples and creates fun games to help the class study before tests.

goto his office hours, he will be very likely to adjust grades if you have a valid argument and if he sees you in office hours he is more likely to help you out in the end (I bombed the final badly... but still got an A in the class because I went to his hours)
seems to take great pleasure in being more intelligent than the class members and would rather you be confused on the test than go over less material

Class is interesting and he makes it easy to pay attention, Discussions on Carmen are mandatory, so BUY THE BOOK! 1 exam got a 96% just by going to class, is VERY helpful with the group research project. He usually doesn't teach right up to the bell, rather gives you time to work on the group project, but you can leave and do it yourself if need be
Very interesting class... useful materials for the real world. Lectures are mandatory, there is class interactivity which stimulates lecture. Professor is very helpful when needed.
Lectures are extremely boring, all the notes are online.  He tries to get the entire class involved in activities when theres like 300+ people in the lecture so its difficult
This is my third class with Dr. Garrett.  His class is interesting but his exams can be difficult.  He is very willing to work with you during office hours if you need extra help.
Super nice guy. Easy class if you pay attention. Most of the grade is a few papers, weekly discussion posts and quizzes.

I took this class as a hybrid-style my freshman year. You basically only came to class to give your speeches and the rest was online. Professor Fisher was extremely caring and helpful. Easy grader and just wanted you to excel at public speaking. Highly recommend.

The first 2 months were pretty textbook heavy with three quizzes (proctored) over them, but one of our first speeches was everyone summarizing different parts of the text to be used as study guides throughout the course. My speaking improved 1000% after her class, and Im so glad I took it. Shes smart, well-spoken, and an amazing teacher!

Nancy is honestly the BEST! She is extremely helpful and cares about you. Makes the class fun too. You do have to work for your grade in speeches. But, overall very applicable class to take for the future. She wants you to succeed!
Nancy was a good professor. Her lectures in public speaking were quite interesting. She actually was demonstrating what she was teaching.

Nancy doesn't waste your time (she often ended class 30 mins early or cancelled it altogether and posted a 10 min lecture on Carmen). She helps you feel comfortable with public speaking and offers areas to improve. There are 3 easy quizzes, 2 exams (info comes straight from the textbook), and 4 speeches. Very straightforward and beneficial course.

Nancy Fisher is a great professor, easy grader, and makes the material of the class interesting. Her lectures are very short, concise, and to the point. Grading criteria is clear, and as long as you're putting the effort in you're likely to get a good grade. Definitely recommend her!
Easy class, but grading is really subjective. Also you only give like 5 speeches the whole semester. Nancy is nice and wants you to do well def a good choice.

Great professor who is there for her students. Where attendance is not taken, you must be at certain classes to receive certain variable points which are given out at random. Also her lectures help to clarify assignments. Overall awesome professor that gives you good useful information you will use in life! I loved the class.

Prof. Nancy Fisher's Comm 2131 is a great class for anyone going into the professional world. She makes the class very genuine and unique. Class usually began w/ speeches given by classmates followed by feedback then a brief lecture from Prof. Fun & interesting class. Follow the rubric, print evaluation forms, do the work and go to class  A

She was honestly one of the best professors Ive had at OSU. She cares a lot about how you are doing in the class and shes very easily accessible, even giving her cell phone number for convenience. Definitely recommend taking public speaking with Nancy, you wont regret it!

Great Professor!! Thought about dropping this class multiple times before it began and very happy I didn't. Nancy made this class very enjoyable and relatable to real world public speaking situations. Lots of speeches that take a decent amount of prep time but overall they are worth doing. Sometimes won't need to attend class if not speaking.
Nancy has been my favorite prof thus far, take the class!

Nancy is awesome! This is the nicest lady I've met at OSU yet. Very casual, tells you to call her Nancy and add her on social media. At the core of her agenda she wants students to gain confidence speaking in front of groups. If you have to take Public Speaking, try to schedule with Nancy.

Nancy was a fantastic professor I really recommend her. She is clear with her instructions and makes the classes interesting. The speeches require a decent amount of practice but they are not that bad in the end. Really good teacher overall. Oh and lectures are often ended early which is nice.
Nancy was really awesome and encouraging all semester. Public speaking isn't easy for everyone and she always gave great feedback as well as made you feel comfortable in your speaking abilities!

This class always has a speech assigned so be ready to always be working on something. It was a lot of fun to have a smaller class and we all got to know each other well! I did enjoy taking this class and Nancy is super nice and easy to talk to! She will help you with anything from the class to an outside interview.
Great professor. The class was centered around several speeches with increasing difficulty. Fun if you put in the effort and are always prepared. Attendance is vital to doing well in the class.

A challenging but not hard class, you work with a real client and Fisher has high expectations. It's great real world experience and definitely something to put on your resume. Not hard to get an A if you go to class and work well with a group. Don't take this class if you plan on skipping! You definitely have to buy the book
Easy class, inconsistent grader.

Very fair and helpful.  We had to give 4 speeches of increasing difficulty and length to the class, following a prescribed outline form which we filled in with information about our individual topics.  As long as you get the speeches done on time you should be fine in the class.  Easy 5 hours!
No Comments
He wasn't very involved in the class. Our lecture was scheduled for 2 hours but only ever lasted 45 minutes so every week I had to sit and wait around until my next class began.
Only required 5 classes to be attended and gave extra credit for participation in lectures. Assignments are easy and he is flexible on deadlines if there are issues. Responds to emails very quickly.

Whatever you do, don't take this class. You'll end up doing the entire group project yourself, and the lectures make zero sense no matter how much you pay attention. Prof. Bayer is clearly a smart guy, but always seems like he'd rather be elsewhere. Not approachable, topics are not explained clearly.

Don't take his classes. He runs through the slides and material super quick. There are no study guides so better look over the terribly out together slides. He tries to make the slides fun and creative but what he needs to do is make boring ones that are full of info

Hes lecture heavy, but his lectures have basically no substance. I think he spent a little too much time figuring out how to best incorporate his bitmoji into his slides, and not enough time including relevant content to make up for our lack of a textbook

Gives you the option of going to class or not. Slides uploaded online to review had little info. Did not use a book so I did not even have material to read to prepare for exams. Did not give class materials to succeed. When I felt like I had mastered the concepts, the exams were EXTREMELY difficult. Final exam class av. 56%, high 87%. nuff said...

AWESOME teacher! He gave students the option of coming to class and getting participation points or not come to class but their whole grade would be from the tests. His lectures are engaging and interactive, and they help you if you don't normally speak up in class.
Good sense of humor and is relatable to students in lectures. Exams/quizzes are a little tricky but the workload isn't difficult. Class is well organized.

This is my second class with Hillary and I've already signed up for a third. She is so funny and very knowledgable about communication. Her class is extremely well run and the assignments are not too time consuming. Each test has a few tricky questions, but if you study you should do fine. Overall, amazing prof.

What a professor! Runs her class so well and makes sure assignments are worthwhile, interesting, and efficient. Lectures are AMAZING; I always looked forward to her class. The expectations are clear, grading is fair, and content is more than interesting. Take Hillary DeAndrea (might be listed as Hillary Shulman) if you can.
Hillary was one of the best lecturers I've had so far. I would highly recommend taking Comm 1100 as a GE. She makes lecture interesting and exams aren't too hard or too long.

Hillary is by far the best professor I have ever had. Three 25 multiple choice question tests. She has random in class assignments (super easy, normally opinion based and less than a sentance) so going to class is needed also because she doesn't post notes online. Overall super easy class. She is so funny so you will actually enjoy going to class

Hands down the best professor I've had at OSU. Hillary makes learning the material fun and interactive. She doesn't offer the notes on Canvas, but going to class isn't a chore. Midterms only include a couple questions from the book so its doable without the reading. Highly recommend!

Hillary is definitely one of the greatest professors I have had in a while. Her classes are so engaging and she is absolutely hilarious. She wants you to succeed as well so don't be afraid to ask questions or go to office hours. I would definitely recommend taking her class.
I love her! She does random attendance quizzes and there's not many grades so GO TO CLASS. She's awesome, interesting, and lectures are laid out well.

Even though Professor Deandrea makes you come to class and work for it. She gives amazing lectures and kids barely sleep in class. It's an amazing lecture with useful materials. Would definitely recommend her.

Chip is a cool dude, but his class is BORING. The class is mostly a discussion on readings and you must participate. There is no final which is nice but there is a quiz due before every class, and it's heavily based on the readings. And you only get 5 minutes on the quiz. Don't be surprised if you end up falling asleep during his lectures.

Chip is really kind, but he cares more about content then students. There is a quiz before every class and the Assignments take forever. If you are just taking this class to get an easy A, its not. you will work for it. The class was very thought provoking though.

Chip is a great professor, he makes the classroom a conversation more than just a lecture hall. The material he covers is great and really has you think about the world of media and communication. I learned a lot from him. Tests and assignments are a little hard but if you put in the time you will do well.

Chip is simply one of the best professors I had at OSU but his class is not for everyone. There is a lot of reading and technology use is frowned upon. But if you are interested in communication or politics, this is a must-take. A course that will truly change your worldview if you put in the effort. Don't skip class (random attendance sign-ups).

Had Chip for Political Comm, never had him for a pre-req course. I loved his class though. Interesting, intense material. People think he's tough, but guess what: he treats his students like adults and wants to make class a discussion, not a lecture. Considerable reading and discussion to expect, but absolutely a get out what you put in course.

Do not take his classes. The class material could be incredibly easy to understand, and he tries to make it sound more complicated to suit his ego.  His tests are unnecessarily difficult and I feel like he does it on purpose. He doesn't get enough love from his department so he takes it out on the students. Stay away from him.

"Chip" may be the worst professor at Ohio State. He is so condescending and full of himself and made the class harder and more boring than it ever needed to be. I looked up his rating before I took the class and he seemed okay but trust me he is not. I hated every second I spent in this class and was beyond glad to see the last of him.
He is funny!

"Chip" is resentful his research can't earn grants and takes it out on students by taking a entry level class full of athletes and people who are just trying to get into the major way to seriously. He makes things unnecessarily difficult and believes he is the "cool" teacher but is unhelpful and screws students over on exams and quizzes. Avoid him!

Chip is great. He really understands theory, but his has a background political communications and often uses political examples for class. This could be helpful in a class with 600 students because everyone has a basic knowledge on political issues. He DOES NOT post lectures note online, so read the textbook & going to office hours &/or see a TA.

Chip is a really nice guy and knows how to explain the material and give good examples. He doesn't give out extra credit and there are only 3 exams, 10 quizzes and 5 CREP experiment points but the material is common sense and easy to grasp. He also gives you a chance to take everything a second time and get the average of your scores.
he took this class waaaay too seriously for a 100 level Comm class.  offers no extra credit and averages your exams and quizzes instead of taking your better score

there is NO opportunity for extra credit and the exam questions can be a little tricky. Make sure you read the questions in entirety. Chip is a good guy but You must come to class to get notes because he wont give them out for any reason. Make a friend in his class so you can give notes to each other. You have to have the book to pass quizzes.
Relatively easy. Need to attend class for notes. Need textbook for quizzes. Exams are somewhat harder than they need to be, but not impossible.

The questions on the exams are right from the power point notes. If you go to class or get the notes from someone it's an easy class. You also are allowed to take exams twice and average the scores. Overall he made the class interesting and I would take him again.

"Chip" is pessimistic and not helpful when it comes to students individually. Lecture notes are ridiculous (grammar, length) and he doesn't have the ability to clarify. He puts most of his work on his TA's and will ramble during lecture- hard to focus. The class is too large for him to care.CERTAINLY made this course more difficult than needed

He was a nice guy who explained the concepts really well and made the subject interesting.  His exams were straight forward from the material and were not trying to trick or mislead, just test your knowledge

At first the class seems difficult but after the first text it's very predictable. The quizzes and exams are straight out of the textbook and notes. Make sure you go to class because he doesn't post his notes. Overall the class really isn't too bad.

He's really funny and makes lectures pretty interesting and fun which made me look forward to going to class. Very interactive with the students during class and clarifies the material better than the textbook does. The book is necessary for both the exams and online quizzes.

He makes class pretty interesting. You don't need to attend because basically the same stuff is in the text book, but he makes it so easy to understand. He's very organized so taking notes is easy. Tests are simple as long as you reread notes and text.

Great teacher. Explains things very clearly and makes the material easy to understand. Shows lots of video clips for examples. Need to attend lecture for notes, and need to read book for easy 5 question quizzes. Tests are not too bad as long as you study your notes and pay somewhat attention in class. Overall pretty easy and enjoyable class.

While he doesn't force you to attended class in order to get credit or anything, you really ought to go to get a good grade. Even though I am a Comm major, I was not looking forward to this class, but Chip really made it interesting and enjoyable. Great professor. Study your notes and the tests will not be difficult.

One of the best professors I've ever had. Does a great job relating course material to the life of a college student. Funny. Exams are super strict but overall pretty easy. If you go to lecture the class is actually pretty  interesting.

Chip is a great guy! BUT he makes things much more difficult than they need to be! His exams are pretty difficult for a 100 level class. If you have the chance, take the same class with a different professor! He NEVER puts his lectures online. Class is Mandatory if you want an A on his 33 question exams worth 100 points.

Relatively difficult exams but quizzes are very simple. Class can be boring, however, he tries to incorporate as many real life examples as possible. This definitely increases the level of entertainment, as well as helping clarify concepts.
One of my best profs. I really enjoy lectures because they are always interesting, relative, and include brief moments of comedy
Very entertaining lecture but it is intro to Comm Theory so be prepared to think. Extra credit opportunities. Very nice guy.
Very straightforward on what he will test you on. Have to go to class since everything he tests you on lecture material. Very Easy

Chip's one of the best pure lecturers I've had at OSU. Class discussion just sort of happens on its own, as opposed to being forced. His exams aren't hard, but can be tricky if you don't take solid notes.
Not a hard class.  He keeps the class interesting and uses the  book a great deal

He's a really nice guy, but his tests are really hard. Be prepared for a lot of studying and memorization. Go to ALL the classes, read the textbook, and empty your brain before the class starts because it is a TON of information.
he is very humor and his class is very clear, easy to understand, take notes, and review them after class, you will get an A
Likes to keep class humorous

In the first two weeks, I was so confused, but after taking the course and because he used real world examples, surprisingly, I ended up liking it a lot. You can apply this class to your life and he is a down to earth professor!
Oh Chip. Chip has a great personality, but the class has a lot of outside readings and work and I found the exams fairly hard considering it was only a 200 level class

You figured if you went to class and kept up you would do well however for the exams you just have to guess from all the material what questions are going to be on it. There are no study guides which sucks. He's a nice guy but his class is a little confusing just because there is no structure, also the lecture are uber boring
nice enough guy, but this class is painful to get through.  most boring lectures every.
I felt like I was being tricked with this class. I went everyday and took every note, and still failed. I felt confused all the time. Definately not my favorite class.

Chip was definitely not one of my favorites. If you looked at a layout of what you were going to learn beforehand and compared it to how he covered it in class, you'd have no idea they were the same. Takes himself way too seriously, and his lectures are less interesting than watching paint dry. Still got a B+ though.

Chip was a great public speaker. He delivers his messages thoroughly and clearly. You should go to class as there are pop quizzes. Also, tests can be difficult, but most of the tests are straight from the textbook so I would read that!

I loved chip. He is a very good lecturer and is very helpful with any questions you may have. You must go to every lecture and take very good notes. His quizzes are a joke, his tests aren't too bad if you study hard for them, and he gives 3 extra credit percentage points. Work hard and you will do fine.
Makes up for the simplicity of the content by using ridiculously tricky and technical wording on the quizzes and tests. Take detailed notes in lecture and of the readings.
Great teacher, excellent layout, funny and laid-back but knows when to be serious... if you want the A in this class, you will have to work for it, but you can do it!

Overall pretty good teacher. His exams are 45% of your grade so you better study up. The exams seem to be pretty tough also for the fact he words them very technically. But overall not the worst class in the world.

Good teacher... he was easy to understand... the class is basically a 2 hour lecture so its hard to keep it interesting but he did a decent job... pop quizzes at the end of some lectures so stick around... copy down the notes from the powerpoints and study them and you will do fine
Very full of himself. Not very helpful.
good professor. Not incredibly easy but teaches well and gets you prepared for his tests.

Chip is a great professor. His class isn't mandatory, but I would suggest you go to it, for quiz purposes as well as his explanation of the material. He is very clear about what hes talking about. He gives quizzes at the end of the class period, so if you go to class DONT LEAVE EARLY! the tests are pretty tricky, but not impossible.

This class was one of my least favorites ever. The material is dry, the professor has a very "I am professor, you are student" type attitude. Don't expect ANYTHING less than to sit and listen for an entire lecture. Final review is five pages long...This teacher isn't the worst but be prepared to teach yourself the material.

Not a very good professor, but lecture was extremely boring, but you had to go because notes were not posted online.  Made the class a lot harder than it had to be, and pretty much set everyone up to fail.  There was a big curve on the exams and the opportunity for extra credit, which was 100% necessary to pass the class.

Chip is a great professor and really knows what he is talking about but his tests are extraordinarily difficult. It's a 200 level class and should not have been this hard. There is up to 3% extra credit and two pop quizzes. Go to class and read the book. Hard work but there is a nice curve.

Chip is a really nice guy and seems genuinely interested in teaching but his tests are far too hard. There is opportunity for extra credit and the class is somewhat interesting but way harder than it needs to be. Take the class, read the book, and pay attention in class (most important)!
Lectures are pretty interesting.  Lots of theories to learn.  Exams are pretty difficult but he curves the grades a little.  Pretty good professor, I just didn't enjoy the class that much.
Lectures are extremely boring, most people feel asleep during it.  Does not post notes online, so you have to go to class. Don't really have to read the book but it would be helpful.
Lots of note taking and two pop quizzes..
Makes a seemingly boring topic interseting.  Very good speaker/ teacher.  Is genuinely interested in what he is teaching--great experience overall!

The class was interesting and engaging.  It often opened with a discussion about a particular study that would then segway into the lecture.  Prof. Eveland is a perfect instructor for the course because this is what his research is focused on.  He also gave a couple students the opportunity to help him and his TA with research which was rewarding.

This class isn't a cake walk, but it is doable if you're willing to put in the time and effort. The required class projects were a bit ridiculous; my group's paper was 31 pages. He is a nice guy though, very fair.
extremely interesting. Conversant and knows the material inside out. Great communicator - almost Ronald Reagan :).

Interesting class, although "CHIP" is so stuck on himself that his lectures consist mostly of his own outside research and journal articles that have nothing to do with the material covered in class.He arrived late to class and often left early.Definately not what I expected from someone of his caliber.
He explains concepts very well and very clear. Goes over numerous examples to ensure clarity. The class was not bad at all.
basically a stats class where the computer does the work for you.  not too hard, i never went and did well.  just make sure you go to recitation

interesting, easy

Persuasive Communication is based around a book written by an OSU professor, and that book kinda sucks. Its like a less clear version of my AP Psychology book. I was able to get 100% on all but 1 paper by writing them in just one day and putting through grammarly. Prof Annen was great about responding to emails but doesnt really do announcements
Easy A, but overall didn't learn a thing. Nice professor. Take this class for an easy pass!

I think that Kaylea definitely cared about the success of students in the class but I don't feel like I took away anything from this class. I was forced to focus more on very specific rubric criteria rather than focusing on becoming a better speaker. I might have misread the course description but I wish I would have taken a different course.

Doesn't understand that I have more things to do than the things in her class. Gave a test over 11 chapters with only 25 questions. Textbook also seems extremely useless for a public speaking course. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!
Class materials not organized. She is a tough grader. Not very caring.
Do never take her course.
hard time

grades hard
too much homework.
I will never take her class again. I gain my first C in my life in her class.

It is a GE course. I think she grade so hard on GE course and she rejected to reply to our questions before the due date. From my perspective, GE is more about expanding my knowledge. And the purpose of assginment is helping us understand the textbook better. Therefore, there is no reason to reject to answer questions before the due date.
She assigns a lot of homework. There should be a TA for her course

Her goal, as stated at the beginning, was not to make us perfect speakers, but to make us better and more comfortable at speaking. I think she did that very well! I was literally never within the time limits, but still got a good grade.

Good and nice Teacher. Just make sure to read the textbook since some of the material on the exam will not be taught in class, and stay on top of material since there are pop quizzes. Also on the 2 papers and final presentation make sure to follow the rubric. Not the easiest class, but if you put in the work you will do fine.

Very friendly and outgoing, but relies too heavily on an unnecessary textbook. Midterm questions pulled straight from it, so required reading to pass. Midterms also overly difficult for a basic public speaking class. Allows students to give speeches on their own interests and offers great feedback. Tough attendance policy.

Kaylea is awesome! She is very nice, funny and knowledgeable. The lectures are relatively short, and interesting. She relates everything to real life which is nice. She definitely cares about your participation in lectures and wants everyone to understand material. The exams are hard, but if you read the textbook you will be fine.
Don't take it if its for an easy A. She grades way to hard.

I took this class as a pilot where the tests were online. If you take this class make sure you take the one where the tests are in class, friends said it was SO EASY. Our class however had difficulty with the much harder online exams. I do not feel like the comm department was fair with the grading and the formatting was usually messed up.

Probably one of the coolest professors ever. I facetimed her once because she forgot to show up for a group meeting and it was great. I texted her a few times as well. She's very willing to help and does a great job at providing an open classroom. Kind of a tough grader but nevertheless, a good professor.

Kaylea creates a welcoming & personal classroom environment which is hard to come by at Ohio State. Her lectures are interesting & she includes real life application that she has had with different aspects of Public Speaking throughout her career.  Tests are hard but keep up with the readings & your solid.  Awesome professor, take her classes.

Kaylea Annen is smart and fun! She actually makes you want to come to class.  She is young and really approachable but has great experienc career-wise. It is always easy to communicate with her. She was willing to go above and beyond in any way for all students. The class objectives and class schedule was clear. Learning from her was fun!
SHE IS AMAZING literally my favorite instructor at OSU. SO friendly and totally relatable. The class was really fun. I wanted to sign up for public speaking just to have her again...

Kaylea was the best professor I've had at OSU so far. Lectures are posted online so note taking isn't needed. The exams are 35 MC and straight from lecture. The book isn't needed and the speeches were explained well in class and very easy. She was extremely helpful with class material and questions about her major or any internship suggestions.

Take this class! Kaylea is great professor who truly takes an interest in her students and wants them to succeed. The class is by no means easy but it is something you will use in your career and other courses. I just wish I had taken this class earlier.
Pretty cool teacher.. A lot of work for a second writing course..hard grader at times Though is clear and prepared for class.. If you do the work you'll get a good grade
Amazing professor! She makes public speaking fun and easy & lots of cool assignments! I highly recommend her class!

Kaylea is an amazing professor! She is willing to help, is super nice, and makes the class easy and enjoyable! She gave points for attending class, but class was often short and enjoyable! She made sure that it was a welcoming environment so giving speeches wasn't a big deal because if you followed the outline she gave you an A! Take her class!!!!!

The lectures were great, you could tell he wanted to make sure that you were understanding the material and keeping up. There is a good amount of reading some weeks but some of it is really interesting. He throws in new articles relevant to what we are learning.
